dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LOCAL RADIO quietly rattles through blown speakers. Four YOUNG MEN lie contorted within, sound asleep. A muted sunbeam cuts through their hanging breath and fin PAT (20s, a doe-eyed vandal) in the rear cargo hold. He blinks awake and sits up, grasping for equilibrium. He turns and wipes the fogged porthole window behind him.

dialogues.speaker: THROUGH THE PORTHOLE
dialogues.text: BATTERED GREEN STALKS tight against the glass.

dialogues.speaker: PAT
dialogues.text: Shit.

dialogues.speaker: FROM WAY UP HIGH
dialogues.text: The weathered conversion van sits in a cornfield, a wake trampled stalks marking its thirty yard drift from the ro The landscape is vast, coastal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pat crawls between the bucket seats and puts a hand on SA (late 20s, scruffy), asleep in the front passenger seat.

dialogues.speaker: PAT
dialogues.text: Sam. Wake-up. REECE (20s, a natural athlete), sits up from between EQUIPMENT CASES, encased in a SLEEPING BAG.

dialogues.speaker: REECE
dialogues.text: What’s wrong?  Pre-Production Draft v.2 (9/07/14) 2 Sam wipes the windshield clear, sees the WALL OF CORN.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: (slapping the driver) What’d you do, Tiger? The driver, TIGER (20s, a wiry mutt with dyed blue hair) jolts alert and surveys the scene.

dialogues.speaker: TIGER
dialogues.text: Did we crash?

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: You tell us, asshole.

dialogues.speaker: TIGER
dialogues.text: Guess I fell asleep.

dialogues.speaker: PAT
dialogues.text: With the engine running. THE FUEL GAUGE NEEDLE SITS BELOW ‘E’.

dialogues.speaker: REECE
dialogues.text: Well done. Sam disconnects his CELL PHONE from a cigarette lighter adapter. It CHIRPS.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Full charge. Did you kill the battery too?

dialogues.speaker: TIGER
dialogues.text: You hear the radio? Pat reaches over, yanks the keys and kills the LOCAL RADI EXT. CONVERSION VAN —- CORNFIELD - DAY 4 TRACKING SAM, swiping his phone, rounding the open rear d of the van as Reece and Tiger unload stickered-up CASES. We see them now. ROCK SHIRTS, TATTOOS, SHITTY HAIRCUTS- THEY’RE A PUNK BAND.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: There’s a skating rink eleven miles from here. Big parking lot. Pat hops from the van, dragging out a battered BMX BIKE.  Pre-Production Draft v.2 (9/07/14)

dialogues.speaker: PAT
dialogues.text: Ice skating or roller skating?

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Just says they’re open. Why? Pat pulls a DUFFEL BAG and GAS CAN from the van.

dialogues.speaker: REECE
dialogues.text: Hockey players whoop more ass.

dialogues.speaker: TIGER
dialogues.text: Dunno, dude- I’ve seen some pretty badass roller skaters...

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: At 7am? I’1l come with. Pat nods, shrugs the Duffel over his shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pat pedals the BMX down the highway, Sam sits atop mounted luggage rack transfixed by his phone, feet the BACK WHEEL PEGS.

dialogues.speaker: PAT
dialogues.text: That thing ruins everything.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: ..-huh?

dialogues.speaker: PAT
dialogues.text: If we didn’t know where we were going, we'd be on a quest. But we do... so it’s an errand. It’s a serene morning, Sam YAWNS. EXT. SKATING RINK —- PARKING LOT - DAY a rear resting on PUSHING IN on a gravel lot. The unmanned BMX wheels down DRAINAGE DITCH and falls over. Pat and Sam follow its path, taking cover in the ditch. S scans the lot as Pat removes a SIPHON KIT from the duffel: 1/4" CLEAR TUBING, a length of BLACK RUBBER HOSE, and a stained RAG.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Thar she blows...  Pre-Production Draft v.2 (9/07/14) 4 Near the edge of the lot sits a monster SUV.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pat and Sam scamper to a crouch beside the SUV. Sam unscrews the gas cap. Pat feeds one end of the clear tubing into the tank, the other into their canister. He shoves the rubber hose into the tank and presses the rag as a seal. Pat blows two hard breaths into the hose. Gas TRICKLES then POURS into the canister. Shared grins. A metal CLANK. ECHOES from a cavernous interior. Pat springs up and peers through the TINTED SUV WINDOWS, seeing PARENTS corralling PEE-WEE HOCKEY PLAYERS from a r access door into the lot. Pat crouches, signals to pack it up. Sam pulls the rig.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pat pedals up the highway, Sam on the rack, hunched over phone. An SUV rounds the corner, its RPMs break the quiet.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: (looking up) Uh oh. Pat turns to see the SUV gaining, CURSES.

dialogues.speaker: SAM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What are we doing?

dialogues.speaker: PAT
dialogues.text: Cover the gas. Get ready to run. Sam hastily covers the gas canister with his jacket as th SUV slows beside them. They look ahead, playing it not-so cool. The SUV window rolls down, revealing a HOCKEY MOM.

dialogues.speaker: HOCKEY MOM
dialogues.text: Not safe, what you boys did...

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: (half-assed) We didn’t do anything, ma’am.  Pre-Production Draft v.2 (9/07/14)

dialogues.speaker: HOCKEY MOM
dialogues.text: I can smell it. (pointing) That’s it, there. Pat drags his feet to a stop. Hockey Mom follows suit. No visible are two PEE-WEE HOCKEY PLAYERS pressed to the bac seat glass.

dialogues.speaker: PAT
dialogues.text: We’re sorry.

dialogues.speaker: HOCKEY MOM
dialogues.text: It’s dangerous. If you boys needed gas, I would've given it to you.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Oh. Thank you. Her scolding eyes.

dialogues.speaker: PAT
dialogues.text: ...sincerely.

dialogues.speaker: HOCKEY MOM
dialogues.text: Next time, you ask.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Yes ma’am. Pat nods earnestly.

dialogues.speaker: HOCKEY MOM
dialogues.text: You broken down? I can give you a ride.

dialogues.speaker: PAT
dialogues.text: We'll be fine.

dialogues.speaker: HOCKEY MOM
dialogues.text: Alright. Be safe, now... and you go with Christ. The SUV cruises off. Sam glances to Pat, who makes the sign of the cross and resumes pedaling. Sam signs the cross with his right hand BUT GRABS IT WITH HIS LEFT, pantomiming an epic hand figh

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Oh no. Oh dear! (death-metal ghoulish)

dialogues.speaker: YEEAAARGHHHH
dialogues.text: 10 11 12 Pre-Production Draft v.2 (9/07/14) 6 Sam's left hand wins out and thrusts into the air: his pi and index fingers protruding from a balled fist: THE MANO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WIND WHIPS through the van. MUSIC BLARES, wild hair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The van cruises along coastal highway.

dialogues.speaker: ON A CELL PHONE TOUCH SCREEN
dialogues.text: ‘Corner of 12th & Ocean_'. A THUMB TAPS THE REST OF THE TEXT MESSAGE: ‘I have a moho ‘SEND’. THE THUMB HASTILY RE-TYPES: ‘Mohawk_’ ‘SEND’. TILT UP to reveal the conversion van GROWL up to the corn TAD (19), in homemade rags sporting a liberty-spiked Moha meets the passenger window as Sam TURNS THE MUSIC DOWN.

dialogues.speaker: TAD
dialogues.text: Sam?

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Tad.

dialogues.speaker: TAD
dialogues.text: Awesome. Hey, I work nights- but I'll catch up with you guys for breakfast. Tad hands over HOUSE KEYS on a chain, ties on an APRON.  13 Pre-Production Draft v.2 (9/07/14) 7

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Okay...

dialogues.speaker: TAD
dialogues.text: I’m in 2R, up the stairs, just crash wherever. Park in the side lot- rear doors tight to the wall so no one steals your shit.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: (looks to Reece, at wheel) Yeah? Reece raises his eyebrows and the van lurches forward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A cramped refuge scattered with ART SUPPLIES, ZINES, and PARAPHERNALIA. Reece steals a workout, chair-dipping in the living area. Sam sorts through PACKETS of Ramen Noodles on the kitchen counter.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: These all have mushrooms. Tiger inspects a bookshelf collection of VINYL LPs.

dialogues.speaker: TIGER
dialogues.text: This dude's legit. Pat examines a cluster of framed CAT PHOTOS on a dresser.

dialogues.speaker: REECE
dialogues.text: Why? (finishing his dips) He gets up early to do his hair? Tiger defensively brushes his hair back and un-sleeves an

dialogues.speaker: TIGER
dialogues.text: He’s true. Sam pulls a SIXER from the fridge, tosses one to Reece, w unplugging the charging phone.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Who you calling?

dialogues.speaker: REECE
dialogues.text: That your business?  14 15 Pre-Production Draft v.2 (9/07/14)

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: I get the bills. Reece backs down, cracks his beer.

dialogues.speaker: PAT
dialogues.text: I’m going to bed.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: (cracking a beer) We're going to drink. Tiger seats the LP on a turntable, sets the needle down, just as the LP CRACKLES TO LIFE with a signature COUNT OF

dialogues.speaker: WE CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. TAD’S APARTMENT - THE NEXT MORNING 14 CLOSE-UP: THE NEEDLE BOBS AT THE EDGE OF THE SPINNING LP. SOFT IN THE BACKGROUND, Pat stands up out of frame, zombi walks to the turntable and powers it down. WE TRACK BEHIND PAT as he grabs half-empty BEER CANS and pours them into the kitchenette sink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tad climbs the steps two at a time carrying grocery bags. WE FLOAT BEHIND PAT as he opens the door for Tad.

dialogues.speaker: TAD
dialogues.text: Morning! (biting lip) You the first to fall asleep? INT. TAD’S APARTMENT - BATHROOM - MORNING 15 Pat is hunched over the sink. He rises, inspecting his fa in the mirror, scrubbing it with a moldy bar of soap. ON PAT’S FACE, crudely penned in SHARPIE: A BIG, STUPID MONOCLE AROUND HIS EYE AND CAT WHISKERS ON HIS CHEEKS.  16 Pre-Production Draft v.2 (9/07/14) 9 INT. TAD’S APARTMENT - LIVING ROOM - MORNING 16 A compact DIGITAL RECORDER blinks RED on a coffee table. The Band sits huddled on a couch, plates of scrambled egg their laps. Tad sits opposite, cross-legged on the floor.

dialogues.speaker: TAD
dialogues.text: ..-working on anything new?

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: A few songs. Maybe enough for a seven-inch.

dialogues.speaker: TAD
dialogues.text: Sweet! Will you actually press one?

dialogues.speaker: REECE
dialogues.text: If we can afford it.

dialogues.speaker: TAD
dialogues.text: I dig the analogue style. Which brings me to the fact: you guys are hard to find. Why no social media presence? Pat contains a wince. Sam turns to face Tiger.

dialogues.speaker: REECE
dialogues.text: Because booking more shows and selling more records would blow.

dialogues.speaker: TIGER
dialogues.text: It’s not hard-rock.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Says the one who gets smashed and plays Darby Crash at the shows I book on my phone... Tiger looks to his plate, eats some eggs.

dialogues.speaker: PAT
dialogues.text: No one wants to starve, but if you take it all virtual, you lose... the texture.

dialogues.speaker: TAD
dialogues.text: What do you mean, texture?

dialogues.speaker: PAT
dialogues.text: Just- you gotta be there. The music is for effect. It’s time and aggression and...  Pre-Production Draft v.2 (9/07/14) 10

dialogues.speaker: REECE
dialogues.text: Technical wizardry.

dialogues.speaker: PAT
dialogues.text: -..t’s shared- live. And then it goes away. The energy- it can’t last.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Unless you’re Iggy Pop.

dialogues.speaker: PAT
dialogues.text: And good for him. I just don’t think I’1l be in my 70’s still listening to Minor Threat.

dialogues.speaker: REECE
dialogues.text: Tiger will. Right?

dialogues.speaker: TIGER
dialogues.text: I won’t live to be seventy. Reece and Sam blurt out mocking laughs, Pat drifts.

dialogues.speaker: TAD
dialogues.text: Okay, so this is a good segue into one of my traditions. For each of you, name your ‘desert island’ band. Reece rolls his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: TIGER
dialogues.text: Only one?

dialogues.speaker: REECE
dialogues.text: If I were to say Black Sabbath, would I get Ozzy and Dio?

dialogues.speaker: TAD
dialogues.text: No caveats- just name the band. Sam, Reece, Pat and Tiger size each other up...

dialogues.speaker: TIGER
dialogues.text: Misfits. No, The Damned. Misfits.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Poison Idea.

dialogues.speaker: PAT
dialogues.text: (under breath) Shit man...  Pre-Production Draft v.2 (9/07/14) 11

dialogues.speaker: REECE
dialogues.text: Cro-Mags. Pat, shaking his head, stressing out.

dialogues.speaker: REECE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Just say something, dude.

dialogues.speaker: TIGER
dialogues.text: Steely Dan.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Candlebox.

dialogues.speaker: REECE
dialogues.text: He’s a Juggalo.

dialogues.speaker: PAT
dialogues.text: Ah, man. (rubs face) Will this be edited?

dialogues.speaker: TAD
dialogues.text: I'll chop it up a bit.

dialogues.speaker: TIGER
dialogues.text: Let it go raw.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: When will this air? Shouldn’t we plug the show?

dialogues.speaker: TAD
dialogues.text: (thrown) Yeah... He turns off the recorder.

dialogues.speaker: TAD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: My last show at the muni center didn’t end well. Lots of vomit. Some fecal matter. Tiger smiles.

dialogues.speaker: TAD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: County commissioner got wind and pulled my permit. You were already en route.

dialogues.speaker: REECE
dialogues.text: Damn dude. We need a kill fee.  17 18 Pre-Production Draft v.2 (9/07/14) 12

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: We went 90 miles out of our way.

dialogues.speaker: TAD
dialogues.text: I’ve got a backup lined-up. Lunch, 50% cut on the door, and you guys would headline.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Anyone else still on the bill?

dialogues.speaker: TAD
dialogues.text: They bailed. Deadpan from the Band as GUITAR FEEDBACK BUILDS...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A waterside mexican cafe. No frills except strung-up CHRISTMAS LIGHTS. THE BAND BLASTS OUT A CHARGED, RAPID-FIRE PUNK SONG. Sam teases FEEDBACK from an AMP with his LES PAUL. Pat on BASS, eyes trained on the floor. Behind a DRUM KIT, Reece strikes with precision. TIGER SCREAMS into a MIC. ON THE ETHNICALLY DIVERSE CROWD: Less than a dozen. Most them sitting down. Some eating Mexican from PAPER PLATES. TAKE-OUT CUSTOMERS plugging their ears as they’re rung-up A DIEHARD, slamdancing with himself. Two BACK-PACK KIDS nodding heads. A FAN, archiving the performance with an iPHONE. The Band screeches to a halt with heaving chests.

dialogues.speaker: TIGER
dialogues.text: (exasperated, to the Fan) Turn that shit off...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tiger rolls CASES to Pat. Pat lifts them into the van. Re shoves them into place. Tad holds two bags of MEXICAN TAKE-OUT, watching Sam coun meager stack of CRUMPLED BILLS.  Pre-Production Draft v.2 (9/07/14) 13

dialogues.speaker: TAD
dialogues.text: I gave you my cut. The house got theirs, but I di-

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: (finishing the count) Split four ways it’s six dollars each.

dialogues.speaker: TAD
dialogues.text: Six eighty-seven. Eighty-eight if you round up. Which I don’t-

dialogues.speaker: REECE
dialogues.text: (charging) You dipshit fashion-punk clown motherFUCKER... Reece SLAMS Tad against a wall, the take-out drops.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Christ.

dialogues.speaker: TIGER
dialogues.text: Easy there, Jujitsu. Reece presses his forearm heavy against Tad’s neck, resis the urge to inflict real damage.

dialogues.speaker: PAT
dialogues.text: (to Reece) Let’s not go to jail too. (to Tad) I think you just ended this tour.

dialogues.speaker: TIGER
dialogues.text: Fuck yes. Let’s call it.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Make a beeline to D.C.? We've got enough for one tank- it’d be siphoning the rest of the way.

dialogues.speaker: REECE
dialogues.text: (releasing Tad) Not a problem. (snatching the take-out) We've got rice and beans!

dialogues.speaker: PAT
dialogues.text: We can head up north and catch 80 all the way. Reece, Tiger and Sam head for the van.  19 Pre-Production Draft v.2 (9/07/14) 14

dialogues.speaker: TAD
dialogues.text: Lemme call my cousin. I can get you a solid gig. Reece mounts the van, SLAMS the door. The rest stick arou

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Where? Here?

dialogues.speaker: TAD
dialogues.text: Scene’s dead. You'd have to dip down closer to Portland. INT./EXT. CONVERSION VAN - TAD’S APARTMENT - NIGHT 19 Tiger sits shotgun, Sam behind the wheel.

dialogues.speaker: TIGER
dialogues.text: I say we just gank his vinyl. Pat and Reece sit eyeballing each other in the back of th IDLING VAN. Sam's phone CHIMES as Tad jogs up to the window.

dialogues.speaker: TAD
dialogues.text: It's set. Matinee tomorrow, Doors at one, you’re on at three. I texted the addy.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: How much?

dialogues.speaker: TAD
dialogues.text: $350, minus your tab. The band plays it down, but this is a windfall.

dialogues.speaker: TAD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And just so you know, it’s mostly boots and braces down there.

dialogues.speaker: TIGER
dialogues.text: Skins? There’s some at every show.

dialogues.speaker: PAT
dialogues.text: SHARP? DMS? Sabre?

dialogues.speaker: TAD
dialogues.text: Right wing- or, technically ultra left- but not affiliated. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pre-Production Draft v.2 (9/07/14) 15

dialogues.speaker: TAD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Dude who owns the venue doesn’t rely on door money- sells more than just booze...

dialogues.speaker: PAT
dialogues.text: But your cousin is cool?

dialogues.speaker: TAD
dialogues.text: Yeah- don’t talk politics, but stick with Daniel. I’d tag along but he and his girl are coming here to crash. Gotta vacuum and shit.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: But no one’s burning crosses or anything- we just play rock?

dialogues.speaker: TAD
dialogues.text: I'd play your earlier stuff. Heavier stuff.

dialogues.speaker: TIGER
dialogues.text: (refined accent) These gentlemen like to mosh.

dialogues.speaker: TAD
dialogues.text: Girls too. It’s sorta the only scene in town. Here... Tad hands Tiger a black and white FLYER.

dialogues.speaker: TAD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I usually keep the originals, but since this one never happened... Tiger tucks the flyer away.

dialogues.speaker: TAD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Can I still run that interview...?

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Yeah- what station is it on?

dialogues.speaker: TAD
dialogues.text: FM eighty-five-five- “Breakfast of Champions”. Thanks. Tiger dials in the station, Sam puts the van in gear and smacks Reece’s arm as they pull out.

dialogues.speaker: REECE
dialogues.text: .--sorry I almost obliterated you!  20 21 22 Pre-Production Draft v.2 (9/07/14) 16

dialogues.speaker: TAD, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Not a problemmmmnn...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PITCH BLACK. The WHIR of the road.

dialogues.speaker: A FLASHLIGHT BEAM POPS ON, SCANS ACROSS HAND DRAWN IMAGES
dialogues.text: Horned skulls, fleshy tendrils and a liquid font of zombi vomit: ‘$5 Matinee! Missionary Position, Ain't Rights, NT Sat lpm Seaside Municipal Center’

dialogues.speaker: TIGER
dialogues.text: At least dude can draw. Tiger hands TAD’S FLYER and the flashlight back to Pat. They're all eating rice and beans with plastic forks. Pat inspects the flyer and offers it to Reece.

dialogues.speaker: PAT
dialogues.text: Pretty sweet. Reece looks up from the flyer, the glow from the flashlig up-lighting his face, and gives Pat a soul-penetrating st

dialogues.speaker: REECE
dialogues.text: There's something I never told you. Anyone, for that matter...

dialogues.speaker: PAT
dialogues.text: What’s that? Holding the stare, Reece RIPS A FART. The Van ERUPTS INTO LAUGHTER as Reece tosses the flyer and Pat pounces.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The van passes an APPLE ORCHARD and turns down a two-lane road bordered by dense inland foliage.

dialogues.speaker: CU
dialogues.text: Mapping Software tracks their position. Nothing else arou  23 24 25 26 Pre-Production Draft v.2 (9/07/14) 17

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FROM ABOVE, TRACKING THE VAN as it’s swallowed by woods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FROM BEHIND a closed ENTRY GATE, with a SIGN facing the r The van whips by...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THROUGH THE WINDSHIELD: the narrow road opens into a cul- sac of dirt and trampled grass. On the far end lies THE VENUE, a converted public utility building of brick and sandstone with a cheap-siding addit extending from the rear. The lot is cluttered with 4x4s, WEATHERED SEDANS and TRIC OUT HATCHBACKS. ROCKERS and SKINHEADS trickle into the ve

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The van rolls up and the Band dismounts, gulping fresh ai they're greeted by DANIEL (27), bomber jacket, boots and grown-in buzz cut, breaking from a group of TAILGATERS admiring a pale gold ‘65 PONTIAC RAGTOP at the lot’s edge

dialogues.speaker: DANIEL
dialogues.text: You guys Tad’s friends?

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: We- he sent us. Cousin Dan?

dialogues.speaker: DANIEL
dialogues.text: (shaking hands) Daniel. You guys look hammered. GABE (30s), crew cut and a general disdain, approaches cradling a clip board.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: One night at Tad’s will do it. And if your girl is crashing t- Daniel grabs Sam and presses their foreheads together.

dialogues.speaker: DANIEL
dialogues.text: (quiet, through a smile) Do not mention that.  27 Pre-Production Draft v.2 (9/07/14) 18

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: I was-

dialogues.speaker: DANIEL
dialogues.text: No worries whatsoever. Just shut the fuck up about him and me and her. Daniel releases shaken Sam with a friendly pat.

dialogues.speaker: GABE
dialogues.text: (arriving) Who’s the Drummer?

dialogues.speaker: REECE
dialogues.text: Me.

dialogues.speaker: GABE
dialogues.text: Just bring your cymbals- you're using the house kit.

dialogues.speaker: REECE
dialogues.text: Okay. Tiger motions to a church-style SIGN out front: In encased changeable letters: ‘1PM DOORS: COWCATCHER, KOKYTUS, AREN'T RIGHTS’ Before Tiger speaks up, Pat calls him off with a look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HARD ROCK over the PA. MOVING DOWN A DARK NARROW HALLWAY: lugging gear, the Band follows Gabe through a backstage corridor. Gabe rounds a corner and gestures to BIG JUSTIN (26), a tattooed heavyweight who dutifully steps aside for the procession. Gabe stops at a graffiti-covered door.

dialogues.speaker: GABE
dialogues.text: (over music)

dialogues.speaker: STAGE IN HERE. KEEP THE HALLWAY
dialogues.text: CLEAR- OWNER DOESN’T FUCK AROUND

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: GoT IT.  28 29 Pre-Production Draft v.2 (9/07/14) 19

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MUFFLED ROCK. A fluorescent-lit interior with carpet remnants, a ratty couch, a bare-bulb Formica makeup count and a coffin-sized bathroom with curtains for a door. Two decades of history told in BAND STICKERS and SHARPIE SCRA Sam yanks ELECTRIC HAIR CLIPPERS from the counter-top out and plugs in his cell phone charger. CHIRP.

dialogues.speaker: PAT
dialogues.text: You okay?

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Yeah. Are these guys not creeps? Tiger and Pat strap on GUITARS, scanning the GRAFFITI SCR Tiger finds a SWASTIKA, looks to Pat.

dialogues.speaker: REECE
dialogues.text: (stacking cases) Run a tight ship.

dialogues.speaker: TIGER
dialogues.text: But it’s a U-boat...

dialogues.speaker: PAT
dialogues.text: Hey ya’ll. I got a dumb idea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sun pours through the high casement windows, side-lightin the gathering crowd. Lots of shaved heads and bomber jack

dialogues.speaker: STAGEHAND
dialogues.text: Where’d you say the power suppl- SAM'S CRUNCHING GUITAR INTERRUPTS. Sound check fiddle-fad as the PA MUSIC fades out.

dialogues.speaker: STAGE MANAGER
dialogues.text: It’s like a mini-transformer, with three females- like an XLR, but not- Pat plays a familiar BASS RIFF.

dialogues.speaker: STAGEHAND
dialogues.text: GoT IT. More GUITAR CRUNCH. Then a LOW, RHYTHMIC TOM DRUM MARCH.  Pre-Production Draft v.2 (9/07/14) 20

dialogues.speaker: TIGER
dialogues.text: (into mic) TEST. ONE-TWO. MEOW. More guitar on mine, please. His monitor turns up, then a look to Reece. Reece nods back. The DRUM MARCH BUILDS.

dialogues.speaker: TIGER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (into mic) Thank you. TUNING guitars, Sam and Pat lean in for an off-mic aside.

dialogues.speaker: YOUR IDEA. YOU BACK OUT NOW, I TELL
dialogues.text: THEM YOU’RE JEWISH. (to Tiger) Go!

dialogues.speaker: TIGER
dialogues.text: (into mic) Okay, everybody! We’re the Ain’t Rights. Or the Aren't Rights. Either one-TWO-THREE-FOUR! !! THE BAND GRINDS STRAIGHT INTO a classic DEAD KENNEDYS SON

dialogues.speaker: TIGER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (singing into mic) Punk ain't no religious cult Punk means thinkin’ for yourself You ain't hardcore ‘cuz you spike your hair, When a jock still lives inside your head... The crowd barely sways, those who know the song give cold stares... TIGER (CONT’D) Nazi punks, Nazi punks Nazi punks- Fuck Off! Nazi punks, Nazi punks Nazi punks- Fuck Off! Now some BOOS and middle fingers.  Pre-Production Draft v.2 (9/07/14) 21 TIGER (CONT’D) If you've come to fight, get outta here, You ain't no better than the bouncers, We ain't trying to be police When you ape the cops it ain't anarchy.. Carving through the crowd, a towering skinhead, WERM (28) appears leading a pack of four: two GUYS, wearing jackets with white stenciled ‘COWCATCHER’ logos, and two GIRLS. TIGER (CONT’D) Nazi punks,Nazi punks Nazi punks- Fuck Off! Nazi punks, Nazi punks Nazi punks- Fuck Off! Making his way across the half-stunned pit, Werm glances at the stage, amused. Behind him, EMILY (20s), with a Chelsea hairdo, crosses p with Daniel, who discreetly passes her a FOLDED NAPKIN an disappears into the crowd. Her eyes meet Pat’s and he is struck. She flips him off. AMBER (20s), lights a cigarette, steering her back on cou TIGER (CONT’D) Ten guys jump one, what a man You fight each other, the police state wins Stab your backs when you trash our halls Trash a bank if you've got real balls A bottle SMASHES on stage, Sam and Pat share nervous smil Tiger flubs some lyrics, Reece drums too fast to notice. TIGER (CONT’D) You still think swastikas look cool The real Nazis run your schools They're coaches, businessmen and cops In a real fourth reich you'll be the first to go... Pat searches for the Emily, but Werm’s pack is gone. He finds Daniel, arms crossed at the exit, watching him. Pat joins Sam off-mic for the chorus:

dialogues.speaker: NAZI PUNKS- FUCK OFF
dialogues.text: (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 30 Pre-Production Draft v.2 (9/07/14) 22

dialogues.speaker: NAZI PUNKS- FUCK OFF
dialogues.text: The rowdy crowd SHOUTS BACK. Another BOTTLE flies on stag

dialogues.speaker: TIGER
dialogues.text: You'll be the first to go You'll be the first to go You'll be the first to go Unless you think! AND THEY GRIND TO A HALT, sweat drenched, tension in the

dialogues.speaker: TIGER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (into mic) Thank you. That was a cover. (off mic to the Band) Whaddya wanna do next? Reece pounds a BROODING DRUM BEAT. The Band trades looks, shrugging acceptance. Sam and Pat TUNE DOWN their guitars and the tone goes evil...

dialogues.speaker: TIGER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Here’s a treat...

dialogues.speaker: THEY PLUNGE INTO CORONARY- A FOOT-STOMPING, HARDCORE ASSA
dialogues.text: The BREAKDOWN hits and the CROWD ERUPTS:

dialogues.speaker: PUSHING DOWN THE HALLWAY, THE DRONE FADES...
dialogues.text: ... INTO EIGHTIES THRASH METAL blasting over the PA. END SLO-MO. Gabe hands Big Justin a WAD OF BILLS by the green room entrance and jogs down an adjacent hallway carrying a GRO BAG, its plastic contents rattling within.  Pre-Production Draft v.2 (9/07/14) 23 The Band rounds the corner, sidestepping THEIR OWN STENCI GEAR, now neatly stacked along the hallway.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: (over music) WHAT HAPPENED TO ‘FIRE CODE’?

dialogues.speaker: BIG JUSTIN
dialogues.text: (counting bills)

dialogues.speaker: BIG JUSTIN
dialogues.text: (handing over bills) YUP. GOTTA CLEAR OUT. Sam takes the cash and looks to Reece, who thumbs-up an equipment inventory.

dialogues.speaker: FOLLOW ME.
dialogues.text: Big Justin grabs a case and leads them away. Tiger, Reece, Sam and Pat grab cases, rolling out in unis Sam stops and pats his pockets.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Shit. My phone...

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: MY PHONE. I’LL CATCH UP. Sam tries to squeeze by but Pat holds up a hand.

dialogues.speaker: I GOT YOU.
dialogues.text: Pat whips around and heads back.

dialogues.speaker: THANKS.
dialogues.text: 31 Pre-Production Draft v.2 (9/07/14) 24 Big Justin turns to roll his case over a floor seam and s Pat moving toward the green room.

dialogues.speaker: HEY
dialogues.text: Hearing only THRASH METAL, Pat casually turns the knob, KNOCKING as he pushes the door open into the room. Big Justin barrels towards him, encumbered by gear... BIG JUSTIN (CONT’D) MOTHER FUCK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pat goes straight for Sam’s phone.

dialogues.speaker: PAT
dialogues.text: (yanking the charger) Pardon me, ya’ll- Four PEOPLE and not a word. All eyes on Pat. And there she is... Bent awkwardly on the couch is Emily, a BUCK KNIFE DRIVEN DEEP INTO HER SKULL. Very little blood.

dialogues.speaker: PAT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Holy shit. Werm looks up, flushed but relaxed. Amber stands horror-struck in the corner.

dialogues.speaker: AMBER
dialogues.text: Call the police. Werm shrugs indifferent.

dialogues.speaker: GUITARIST
dialogues.text: Fuck that. Big Justin BURSTS into the room.

dialogues.speaker: I TOLD YOU...
dialogues.text: (big breaths) .-.to follow. Pat dry swallows. Then BOLTS TO THE DOOR WITH THE PHONE.  32 33 Pre-Production Draft v.2 (9/07/14) 25 Big Justin grabs a fistful of hoodie, RIPPING it off as P scrambles past...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pat leaps across the threshold with a stretched t-shirt, DIALING and flailing, the charger dangling from the phone

dialogues.speaker: PAT
dialogues.text: The Band catches on as Big Justin emerges, eyes bulging. Avoiding their strewn gear, Pat re-directs down the adjac hall, the Band right behind.

dialogues.speaker: PAT
dialogues.text: (into cell) YES, IT IS... Gabe appears at the far end of the hallway with the DRUMM

dialogues.speaker: PAT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (into cell) I DON’T- A ROCK CLUB... They sprint to intercept.

dialogues.speaker: THERE'S BEEN A STABBING, SH-
dialogues.text: Gabe SMACKS the phone from Pat and the DRUMMER follows through with a BRUTE-FORCE SHOVE. Gabe dives for the cell: ON THE PHONE: ‘911: 00:14...00:15...’ Gabe ends the call and pops up.

dialogues.speaker: GOD DAMMIT.
dialogues.text: Big Justin brings up the rear, the Band caught mid-hallwa

dialogues.speaker: BIG JUSTIN
dialogues.text: They di- Gabe points to his ear.  34 35 Pre-Production Draft v.2 (9/07/14) 26 BIG JUSTIN (CONT’D) THEY DIDN’T LOCK THE DOOR-

dialogues.speaker: GABE
dialogues.text: NO. DON’T TALK. AND DON’T TOUCH THEM. (to Band) STAY PUT. Gabe speaks into the Drummer’s ear. The Drummer nods.

dialogues.speaker: GABE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (to Band) I'LL BE RIGHT BACK. DON’T WORRY. The Drummer backs off and leans against the wall. Big Jus stands opposite, the Guitarist visible over his shoulder the green room doorway, Amber within, her pleading eyes.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: (to Pat)

dialogues.speaker: GABE
dialogues.text: (turning back) GIMME A MINUTE AND SAVE THE TALK. The Band processing adrenaline.

dialogues.speaker: GABE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (to Sam) SOMETHING TERRIBLE. Pat nods compliance. Gabe disappears with the phone around a corner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON A WIDE: The back door opens and shuts, briefly polluti the quiet air with THRASH METAL. Gabe walks several yards to an OFFICE TRAILER. He disappe for several seconds, re-emerging with an awkward stride..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON THE BAND: simmering, sharing looks, METAL still blarin Breathing regulates... -.-until Gabe returns with a RUGER .454 SUPER-REDHAWK REVOLVER by his side.  Pre-Production Draft v.2 (9/07/14) 27

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Fuck me.

dialogues.speaker: DON'T WORRY.
dialogues.text: (gesturing with gun) JUST GET BACK INSIDE. Sam's cell RINGS, glowing in Gabe’s other hand.

dialogues.speaker: GABE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: LET’S GO!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone shuffles inside, amped-up and bewildered.

dialogues.speaker: GABE
dialogues.text: Turn the PA down! He closes the door, Sam’s phone still RINGING. The Drummer reaches inside a counter cabinet and slides t fader on a two-channel MIXING BOARD wired to a ‘90s STERE

dialogues.speaker: BIG JUSTIN
dialogues.text: They didn’t lock it. Tiger sees the body, the knife, gestures to Reece and Sam

dialogues.speaker: GUITARIST
dialogues.text: You were right there!

dialogues.speaker: BIG JUSTIN
dialogues.text: Until I wasn‘ t-

dialogues.speaker: GABE
dialogues.text: (hand up) Quiet! The THRASH METAL zeroes out, the Guitarist whips to Gabe.

dialogues.speaker: GABE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (cordial, into phone) Hello? Yes, but we got cut off, it’s a bit- yes, ma’am...  Pre-Production Draft v.2 (9/07/14) 28 Gabe backs out the door...

dialogues.speaker: GABE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (into phone) We called to report a stabbing... THE DOOR SHUTS. Behind it, GABE’S MUFFLED WORDS. Everyone eavesdropping until Gabe pops back through the d

dialogues.speaker: BIG JUSTIN
dialogues.text: You call Darcy?

dialogues.speaker: GABE
dialogues.text: He’s on his way. (gesturing to the corpse) Knows about that... (gesturing to the band) Not this...

dialogues.speaker: REECE
dialogues.text: You can’t keep us here.

dialogues.speaker: GABE
dialogues.text: We're not keeping you. You’re just staying. (nodding to Big Justin) You're up. Gabe hands Big Justin the gun.

dialogues.speaker: TIGER
dialogues.text: The fuck is that supposed to mean?

dialogues.speaker: GABE
dialogues.text: (exiting) Relax. Cops are on the way. SLAM. Big Justin locks the dead bolt, glares at the Guitarist.

dialogues.speaker: BIG JUSTIN
dialogues.text: See how easy th- ? The victim’s Friend POUNCES ON WERM, her vicious strikes unanswered until the Guitarist pulls her off and THROWS H AGAINST THE WALL.

dialogues.speaker: GUITARIST
dialogues.text: Chill the fuck out, Amber. Big Justin takes position by the door, pointing the gun.  Pre-Production Draft v.2 (9/07/14) 29

dialogues.speaker: BIG JUSTIN
dialogues.text: Yes please...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabe steps in, CLARK (40s), a grizzled scarecrow, rises f behind the desk of this dated but tidy office. Cubby hole and shelves of WHITE-POWER/NAZI MERCHANDISE line the wall

dialogues.speaker: CLARK
dialogues.text: Darcy here?

dialogues.speaker: GABE
dialogues.text: Not yet. I need six hundred cash.

dialogues.speaker: CLARK
dialogues.text: (opening a CASH BOX) You just signed out three fifty-

dialogues.speaker: GABE
dialogues.text: Someone's dead.

dialogues.speaker: CLARK
dialogues.text: Still gotta keep the books.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clark locks the office door, Gabe power-walks ahead.

dialogues.speaker: CLARK
dialogues.text: (catching up) What do you need?

dialogues.speaker: GABE
dialogues.text: A true believer.

dialogues.speaker: CLARK
dialogues.text: ..-how ‘bout two?

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Maybe she’s not dead. The Guitarist BLURTS a laugh. AMBER shoots him daggers.

dialogues.speaker: SAM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (calming hand) Just saying. There’s no blood. Who's to say we-  40 Pre-Production Draft v.2 (9/07/14) 30 Werm grips the buck knife and tugs, jerking the body off couch and onto the floor. He re-grips, puts a boot next t the wound and YANKS THE KNIFE FROM THE SKULL WITH TWO HAN BLOOD POURS.

dialogues.speaker: WERM
dialogues.text: There it is!

dialogues.speaker: AMBER
dialogues.text: My god. Tiger's eyes dart around the room. Pat closes his.

dialogues.speaker: BIG JUSTIN
dialogues.text: C’mon, man! What are you doing? The Guitarist grabs a worn towel from the makeup counter drapes it over the Victim’s face.

dialogues.speaker: REECE
dialogues.text: (to Sam) The time to go is now.

dialogues.speaker: WERM
dialogues.text: See that... ON THE DRAPED TOWEL: BLOOD BLOOMS from underneath.

dialogues.speaker: TIGER
dialogues.text: (inching to the door) We didn’t see shit. We were so drunk...

dialogues.speaker: BIG JUSTIN
dialogues.text: (aiming gun) Just wait. Cops are on the way.

dialogues.speaker: APPROACHING SIRENS.
dialogues.text: Gabe grips two SKINHEAD TWINS (20s) by their necks, huddl in silhouette against the low sun. Clark stands facing the road.

dialogues.speaker: GABE
dialogues.text: You good? Twin #1 nods.  Pre-Production Draft v.2 (9/07/14) 31

dialogues.speaker: GABE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Good? Twin #2 nods.

dialogues.speaker: GABE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Above and beyond, gentlemen. Need me to do it?

dialogues.speaker: TWIN
dialogues.text: Nope, we got this.

dialogues.speaker: TWIN
dialogues.text: Won't even be the first time.

dialogues.speaker: GABE
dialogues.text: Hurry. Gabe hands SOMETHING off and breaks from the huddle. The Twins tighten into a Thai-clinch.

dialogues.speaker: TWIN
dialogues.text: GO. Mhmmmmmmmmm. . . And Twin #2 jabs Twin #1 in the ribs. THFFT.

dialogues.speaker: TWIN
dialogues.text: (clenched teeth) Yup. Mhmmmmmmmmm.. . THFFT. Another JAB, and a pained exhale. FLASHING LIGHTS through the trees.

dialogues.speaker: CLARK
dialogues.text: (turning) Okay that’s it! Clark walks coolly back towards the venue. Twin #2 hands Gabe a fluid-slick COMPACT TACTICAL KNIFE.

dialogues.speaker: GABE
dialogues.text: (waving it off) Let them see it. Twin #1 raises his shirt to present the wound: TWO SLIVER PUNCTURED YELLOW TISSUE, ONE SEEPING BLOOD.

dialogues.speaker: GABE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: The knife. It’s an inch too short for felony possession, so don’t worry- actually, gimme back the money.  4l Pre-Production Draft v.2 (9/07/14) 32

dialogues.speaker: TWIN
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: GABE
dialogues.text: Vouchers and shit- we’ll hold it for you... The twins dig in their pockets and hand over the BILLS.

dialogues.speaker: GABE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: If you do any time, we double it.

dialogues.speaker: TWIN
dialogues.text: (handing over HOUSE KEYS) Make sure someone waters my hibiscus... Gabe stuffs the money in his pocket, turns back to Clark, steps from the venue doorway, waving various SKINS and ROCKERS outside.

dialogues.speaker: CLARK
dialogues.text: (lighting cigarette) Check out those jokers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TWO POLICE CRUISERS and an AMBULANCE kick dust into the l killing their SIRENS. Stepping forward from the gathering crowd, Twin #1 offers disarming wave, Twin #2 tosses the knife on the ground. Two POLICE OFFICERS emerge from the cruisers as a SPRINTE TRUCK enters the lot and pulls up beside the Band’s conversion van. In custom paint: ‘BANKER’S HEATING AND VENTILATION’. DARCY (50s), steps from the truck, utterly unthreatening, with tucked-in plaid and dad-slacks. Darcy waves off the crowd and greets an officer, his char cutting through the air. INT. GREEN ROOM - LATE AFTERNOON 4l Big Justin leans against the door, gun by his waist. Pat, Sam, Tiger and Reece: standing in silence. Amber watches the Drummer tap DRUMSTICKS on his lap.  Pre-Production Draft v.2 (9/07/14) 33 Werm sits on the floor, elbows on knees. KNOCK-KNOCK-KNOCK. Big Justin twists, unlocks and opens the door for Gabe.

dialogues.speaker: GABE
dialogues.text: Cowcatcher. Clear out. Gabe snags a bag and a SET-LIST from the counter. Werm takes his time getting up.

dialogues.speaker: PAT
dialogues.text: Where are the cops?

dialogues.speaker: GABE
dialogues.text: (to Guitarist) Get your stuff. The Drummer tosses his sticks in the trash on the way out the Guitarist grabs his GUITAR and follows.

dialogues.speaker: TIGER
dialogues.text: What about us?

dialogues.speaker: BIG JUSTIN
dialogues.text: Gabe. C’mon. Gabe leans in, WHISPERING to Big Justin. Reece makes eye contact with Sam and Pat, shakes his head

dialogues.speaker: AMBER
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: GABE
dialogues.text: Sorting this out. Hang tight. Werm hangs mid exit, turning to Sam and Pat.

dialogues.speaker: WERM
dialogues.text: Your set was good.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: WERM
dialogues.text: What was the second to last song?

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Uh, Toxic Evolution..?  Pre-Production Draft v.2 (9/07/14) 34

dialogues.speaker: WERM
dialogues.text: It’s fucking hard, man. That’s the one I did her to. Gabe ushers Werm out and SHUTS THE DOOR behind them. Big Justin breathes deep, locks the deadbolt and takes position by the door.

dialogues.speaker: REECE
dialogues.text: So... he’s got six bullets.

dialogues.speaker: BIG JUSTIN
dialogues.text: For real?

dialogues.speaker: REECE
dialogues.text: If we all go at once...

dialogues.speaker: TIGER
dialogues.text: Christ, hold off a second.

dialogues.speaker: REECE
dialogues.text: For what?!

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: We haven't done anything.

dialogues.speaker: AMBER
dialogues.text: Doesn’t matter.

dialogues.speaker: BIG JUSTIN
dialogues.text: They're called cartridges. (showcasing the revolver) The bullet is the part that enters your brain if you keep talking shit. And this one holds five cartridges, not six. Because they’re big as fuck and only five fit the cylinder. So please shut the fuck up and do not test me.

dialogues.speaker: TIGER
dialogues.text: (to Reece) You're making it worse. Reece shoots Tiger a look.

dialogues.speaker: BIG JUSTIN
dialogues.text: We sit. We wait.

dialogues.speaker: AMBER
dialogues.text: And we die.  42 Pre-Production Draft v.2 (9/07/14) 35

dialogues.speaker: BIG JUSTIN
dialogues.text: Not if you sit and you wait.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darcy watches Clark slip on GLOVES and search the cabin o the Band’s van. Gabe shadows them, CLICKING Sam’s cell ph

dialogues.speaker: GABE
dialogues.text: ...dJust the one to 911 at 3:45. Then mine was at 3:47. PM.

dialogues.speaker: DARCY
dialogues.text: You called?

dialogues.speaker: GABE
dialogues.text: They- 911 called back and I answered.

dialogues.speaker: DARCY
dialogues.text: Be clear. Who else knows besides- you said Daniel’s cousin?

dialogues.speaker: GABE
dialogues.text: Tad- text from him last night with our address, but he doesn’t know anything. Darcy turns to Gabe as Clark pops the glove compartment a removes the flashlight.

dialogues.speaker: DARCY
dialogues.text: Except who they are, where they are and maybe where they’re supposed to be next. Check emails?

dialogues.speaker: CLARK
dialogues.text: They played their set. For the crowd.

dialogues.speaker: DARCY
dialogues.text: We'll assume the wide world knows. And they'll be tracking that. Darcy gestures to SAM’S PHONE. Gabe tosses it to Clark, w wipes it clean and shuts it in the glove compartment.

dialogues.speaker: GABE
dialogues.text: I just wanted to buy some time, contain it until you-

dialogues.speaker: DARCY
dialogues.text: Contain?  Pre-Production Draft v.2 (9/07/14) 36

dialogues.speaker: GABE
dialogues.text: It was pretty rapid fire...

dialogues.speaker: DARCY
dialogues.text: I appreciate your initiative, and we all love Werm...

dialogues.speaker: GABE
dialogues.text: He’s a brother.

dialogues.speaker: DARCY
dialogues.text: Then you could've visited him in prison. Makes all the difference. Gabe, shaken.

dialogues.speaker: DARCY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Now we’re all in the stew. Clark CLICKS the flashlight on, climbs into the cargo hol

dialogues.speaker: DARCY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: For an impulsive act. A selfish act. (moving within inches) Under my roof. Darcy closes the driver’s side door and walks to the rear TRACKING inside the shadowed van, flashlight sweeping, th beam landing on the DUFFEL BAG.

dialogues.speaker: DARCY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: (muffled, outside van) Do you see a way out of this? The pair revealed again as Darcy opens the rear doors.

dialogues.speaker: GABE
dialogues.text: For them? No.

dialogues.speaker: DARCY
dialogues.text: We still need to think of one. Clark removes the contents of the duffel, training the flashlight beam_on THE SIPHON KIT AND GAS CAN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darcy uncaps the can, inhales the fumes.

dialogues.speaker: DARCY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Okay. This is good. FEEDBACK from the Venue. All three men look back.  Pre-Production Draft v.2 (9/07/14) 37

dialogues.speaker: DARCY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: No guns. Clark, you got a ‘no trespassing’ sign posted at the residence?

dialogues.speaker: CLARK
dialogues.text: Got ‘beware of dogs’.

dialogues.speaker: DARCY
dialogues.text: That’s better.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 43 MUFFLED, THROUGH THE DOOR: LIVE GRIND CORE MUSIC ERUPTS. It takes a beat for it to register. Reece curls a lip at Big Justin, who can’t

dialogues.speaker: TIGER
dialogues.text: (inspecting the walls) Does anyone know we’re in here?

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: No one who cares. Tad?

dialogues.speaker: PAT
dialogues.text: I think we go.

dialogues.speaker: REECE
dialogues.text: (rolls shoulders, stretches neck) I think we go.

dialogues.speaker: BIG JUSTIN
dialogues.text: (cocks the hammer) The next person t- KNOCK KNOCK.

dialogues.speaker: GABE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: (muffled, through door)

dialogues.speaker: EVERYONE OKAY
dialogues.text: Eyes gravitate to the corpse and back.

dialogues.speaker: YEAH. OPEN UP.
dialogues.text: Big Justin backs towards the door. find words.  Pre-Production Draft v.2 (9/07/14) 38

dialogues.speaker: AMBER REECE
dialogues.text: No. Stop!

dialogues.speaker: PAT
dialogues.text: Where are the cops?

dialogues.speaker: BIG JUSTIN
dialogues.text: Want me to open the door or shoot you in the face? Reece stalks closer. Amber and Pat too. BIG JUSTIN (CONT’D) BACK THE FUCK OFF.

dialogues.speaker: BIG JUSTIN
dialogues.text: ‘TRYING TO RUSH ME.

dialogues.speaker: BIG JUSTIN
dialogues.text: THAT’S ON THEM.

dialogues.speaker: WHERE ARE THE COPS
dialogues.text: A muddled CACOPHONY of pleas and threats..

dialogues.speaker: GIVE THEM THE GUN.
dialogues.text: Everyone stops.

dialogues.speaker: GABE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: IT’S OVER. GIVE THEM THE GUN.

dialogues.speaker: OVER. NOW. DO NOT SHOOT THEM
dialogues.text: Big Justin lowers the revolver.

dialogues.speaker: IS DARCY HERE
dialogues.text: Pre-Production Draft v.2 (9/07/14) 39

dialogues.speaker: HE IS.
dialogues.text: A THROAT CLEARS on the other side of the door.

dialogues.speaker: DARCY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: (muffled, through door) I AM. GENTLEMEN, I’M THE OWNER.

dialogues.speaker: BIG JUSTIN
dialogues.text: (muttering) .--didn’t you just say... Big Justin removes the .454 CARTRIDGES from the cylinder.

dialogues.speaker: DARCY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: TRULY SORRY ABOUT THIS. I’M PLAYING CATCH-UP HERE MYSELF.

dialogues.speaker: AMBER
dialogues.text: (re: the live music) They're playing a fucking show.

dialogues.speaker: CARTRIDGES .
dialogues.text: Big Justin hands the revolver to Sam.

dialogues.speaker: I'VE GOT NO PROBLEM WITH THAT.
dialogues.text: Big Justin pockets the cartridges. Reece sidesteps toward the door.

dialogues.speaker: BIG JUSTIN
dialogues.text: THEY’VE GOT THE GUN NOW. OPENING UP...

dialogues.speaker: REECE
dialogues.text: Stop.

dialogues.speaker: TIGER
dialogues.text: Let him open the door. He gave over the gun-

dialogues.speaker: BIG JUSTIN
dialogues.text: No one’s ‘letting’ me do anything.

dialogues.speaker: HOW'RE WE DOING
dialogues.text: Reece looks to Amber, she shakes her head.  Pre-Production Draft v.2 (9/07/14) 40

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: He’s right.

dialogues.speaker: TIGER
dialogues.text: (anxiously rubbing face) Who? Me?

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Pat. Do the math- WHERE ARE THE

dialogues.speaker: IN THE MEANTIME...
dialogues.text: Big Justin turns to the door, reaches...

dialogues.speaker: BIG JUSTIN
dialogues.text: You got the damn g- AAHHHHH! TIGER CHARGES BIG JUSTIN, EYES AFLAME. Big Justin SLIDES THE DEAD BOLT LATCH HALF OPEN. Reece lunges to SLAP IT CLOSED as Big Justin pivots to fe off TIGER’S FOREARM BITES. TWO THUD PUNCHES TO THE TEMPLE SEND TIGER TO THE FLOOR. REECE LEAPS FROM BEHIND, WRAPPING UP BIG JUSTIN’S WRISTS

dialogues.speaker: REECE
dialogues.text: Get him down! Amber runs up and BOOT-STOMPS JUSTIN’S KNEES, TOPPLING HI AND REECE TO THE GROUND.

dialogues.speaker: DARCY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: WHAT’S HAPPENING?! AMBER PUTS A BOOT OVER BIG JUSTIN’S FACE AS REECE SNAKES LIMBS AROUND BIG JUSTIN’S UPPER TORSO, SECURING HIM IN A ‘CRUCIFIX POSITION’ ARM LOCK. The door handle RATTLES. Locked. Pat grabs a side of the couch and looks to Sam, fumbling the revolver. Amber lifts her boot with a grin.  44 Pre-Production Draft v.2 (9/07/14) 41

dialogues.speaker: AMBER
dialogues.text: (to Big Justin) Shouldn’t have locked the door. She grabs the other end of the couch, sliding it with Pat blockade the door.

dialogues.speaker: REECE
dialogues.text: Get the bullets. Amber and Pat rush back over, digging cartridges from Big Justin’s pocket.

dialogues.speaker: REECE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Load it. I got him. Big Justin flushes with rage, now powerless.

dialogues.speaker: NOT GOO-
dialogues.text: Big Justin GRUNTS as Reece tightens his grip.

dialogues.speaker: PAT
dialogues.text: IT’S FINE. WE’D JUST RATHER WAIT FOR THE POLICE.

dialogues.speaker: JUSTIN
dialogues.text: Sam engages the loaded cylinder aims the revolver at Just Reece winces from the line of fire, Pat motions for Sam t lower the barrel.

dialogues.speaker: PAT
dialogues.text: HE'S FINE, BUT HE’S GONNA WAIT TOO.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darcy and Gabe pressed to the door. Clark standing by.

dialogues.speaker: DARCY
dialogues.text: UNDERSTOOD, GENTLEMEN. Hold tight. Darcy turns, takes a moment.

dialogues.speaker: GABE
dialogues.text: Think they know?  42 Pre-Production Draft v.2 (9/07/14)

dialogues.speaker: DARCY
dialogues.text: I think they’re SMARTER THAN YOU!!! DARCY FACE-PALMS GABE AND SLAMS HIM TO THE WALL.

dialogues.speaker: CLARK
dialogues.text: Darcy, man... Gabe gets to his feet, ready for more. Darcy catches his breath, his lips quivering.

dialogues.speaker: DARCY
dialogues.text: I apologize... We’ll do it here. Stage it up the road.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 45 MUFFLED MUSIC through the door. Tiger plants his hands to rise, Pat helps him to the couc

dialogues.speaker: PAT
dialogues.text: What was that gonzo shit?

dialogues.speaker: TIGER
dialogues.text: I did the math.

dialogues.speaker: REECE
dialogues.text: So... Reece maintains his joint lock on Big Justin. (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: REECE
dialogues.text: -in a tournament, I snap his arm or he taps out and we get burgers.

dialogues.speaker: AMBER
dialogues.text: Snap it.

dialogues.speaker: BIG JUSTIN
dialogues.text: Come on...

dialogues.speaker: PAT
dialogues.text: We've got the gun. Let him-

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Wait. I don’t feel good with it. (offering the revolver) Who wants it?

dialogues.speaker: TIGER
dialogues.text: No way...  Pre-Production Draft v.2 (9/07/14) 43

dialogues.speaker: PAT
dialogues.text: (shaking head) Can’t shoot.

dialogues.speaker: AMBER
dialogues.text: I can.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Not you.

dialogues.speaker: AMBER
dialogues.text: Then fucking keep it.

dialogues.speaker: REECE
dialogues.text: Just keep it, Sam. I’1l take it when I’m up. (to Big Justin) When I let go, what are you going to do?

dialogues.speaker: BIG JUSTIN
dialogues.text: Buttfuck everyone in the room. Reece calmly leans back, hyper-extending Big Justin’s elb until a SUBTLE PROTRUSION surfaces. BIG JUSTIN (CONT’D) OwOwOwOwOw. . .

dialogues.speaker: REECE
dialogues.text: You're going to sit crisscross apple sauce. Big Justin nods.

dialogues.speaker: REECE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Say it.

dialogues.speaker: BIG JUSTIN
dialogues.text: I’m gonna sit crisscross appl... Working his hips and pushing off, Reece has already disengaged the joint lock. He rolls to his feet.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Nice. Sam hands Reece the revolver.

dialogues.speaker: PAT
dialogues.text: (to Amber) Is there another way out? Amber shakes ‘no’. Tiger scoots a CHAIR from the wall.  Pre-Production Draft v.2 (9/07/14) 44

dialogues.speaker: TIGER
dialogues.text: There’s gotta be something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabe leans over the desk, scribbling names on a POST-IT.

dialogues.speaker: DARCY
dialogues.text: You fed them yet today?

dialogues.speaker: CLARK
dialogues.text: (sliding on a JACKET) Doesn't matter- they’re professionals.

dialogues.speaker: DARCY
dialogues.text: Might lose a couple by the morning. Maybe a bunch.

dialogues.speaker: CLARK
dialogues.text: Like I said, they’re pros. They earn.

dialogues.speaker: DARCY
dialogues.text: You’1l be compensated. (to Gabe) Christ. How many people on that list? Gabe drops the pen and stands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clark locks the trailer door, hands Darcy a MASTER KEY CH

dialogues.speaker: CLARK
dialogues.text: Twelve hundred for a prospect. Two for a bait dog. No studs. No champs. Unless you wanna pay twenty grand a head...

dialogues.speaker: DARCY
dialogues.text: (a patient stare) This might cost you your livelihood, Clark. As long as it doesn’t cost me mine, you're covered.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darcy leads Clark and Gabe down the hallway.  Pre-Production Draft v.2 (9/07/14) 45

dialogues.speaker: DARCY
dialogues.text: There’s going to be cops, so clean out the residence. Maybe leave ‘em a roach in the ashtray... The trio stomp past the green room door, going single fil they pass the BAND’S GEAR littering the hallway.

dialogues.speaker: DARCY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (to Gabe) Get Daniel on that door and pull their van around - shit, keys?

dialogues.speaker: GABE
dialogues.text: I guess inside with them.

dialogues.speaker: DARCY
dialogues.text: We'll need ‘em.

dialogues.speaker: CLARK
dialogues.text: I’ve got a ton of shit to do.

dialogues.speaker: DARCY
dialogues.text: Go on. Clark starts down the hall, Darcy points to the stacked g

dialogues.speaker: DARCY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: This is a fire hazard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darcy and Gabe turn the corner, passing COWCATCHER ON STA BLASTING GRINDCORE TO A FRENZIED CROWD.

dialogues.speaker: FINE. PLENTY TO DO.
dialogues.text: They reach the bar, Darcy leans to the BARTENDER, already pouring him the usual in a SHOT GLASS. DARCY (CONT’D)

dialogues.speaker: BARTENDER
dialogues.text: STEPPED OUT. I’M COVERING. (hand under the bar)

dialogues.speaker: EVERYTHING OKAY
dialogues.text: Darcy leaves the POURED SHOT, Gabe follows him out.  Pre-Production Draft v.2 (9/07/14) 46

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The driver's door of the conversion van opens, Gabe climb in, Darcy steps back.

dialogues.speaker: DARCY
dialogues.text: Meet me by the utility shed. Gabe checks under the visor, feels for keys in the igniti A V-8 ENGINE CHUGS AND STARTS. Confused, Gabe looks to Darcy, who’s tracking the sound.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daniel fidgets in his ‘65 ragtop, the engine idling, sudd anxious to see Darcy and Gabe close in.

dialogues.speaker: DARCY
dialogues.text: This the new ride?

dialogues.speaker: DANIEL
dialogues.text: Yeah, just turning it over. Think it’s getting choked. Wrong filter.

dialogues.speaker: DARCY
dialogues.text: She's a beaut. Daniel locks eyes with Gabe, kills the engine.

dialogues.speaker: DANIEL
dialogues.text: What’s up?

dialogues.speaker: DARCY
dialogues.text: Need some of the squad. Red laces only.

dialogues.speaker: DANIEL
dialogues.text: Tonight?

dialogues.speaker: DARCY
dialogues.text: Now. (to Gabe) That list... Gabe hands over the POST-IT.

dialogues.speaker: DARCY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: This is everyone who knows?

dialogues.speaker: GABE
dialogues.text: Yes. Including the band.  Pre-Production Draft v.2 (9/07/14) 47

dialogues.speaker: DANIEL
dialogues.text: Knows what?

dialogues.speaker: DARCY
dialogues.text: (handing back the Post-it) Manageable. From here on out, not a single name gets added... Daniel climbs out of the convertible.

dialogues.speaker: DARCY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: ...unless they’ve got red laces.

dialogues.speaker: GABE
dialogues.text: There's eighty people in there.

dialogues.speaker: DARCY
dialogues.text: (to Daniel) You, plus four. Daniel turns, shoving his keys in his pocket.

dialogues.speaker: DARCY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Give Gabe your keys. Daniel pivots, flustered.

dialogues.speaker: DARCY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: In case we gotta play valet. Daniel folds the keys up in the sun visor.

dialogues.speaker: DARCY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (nodding) We're losing light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BUZZING LIGHT FLICKERS DEAD AS A 4’ FLUORESCENT BULB IS TWISTED FROM ITS CEILING BALLAST. Tiger hands the bulb to Sam, who places it on the counter

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Watch out, those could be live...

dialogues.speaker: TIGER
dialogues.text: That's speaker wire. Tiger yanks down an ALUMINUM DROP CEILING T-BAR. Pat watching, turns to Amber.  Pre-Production Draft v.2 (9/07/14) 48

dialogues.speaker: PAT
dialogues.text: You don’t have a phone, do you?

dialogues.speaker: AMBER
dialogues.text: They took it. Pat gestures to the corpse.

dialogues.speaker: AMBER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: ..-hers too.

dialogues.speaker: PAT
dialogues.text: (reverently) I’m going to search her, okay? A flash of protest, then a nod. Pat crosses. Reece sits on the floor by the couch, revolver in hand, e on Big Justin. Big Justin sits cross-legged in the corner, eyes on Pat. Pat kneels by the body, digging through pockets. He pulls out a LIGHTER, sets it on the floor.

dialogues.speaker: TIGER
dialogues.text: We could start a fire? Pat pulls out a PACK OF CIGARETTES, sets it down.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: That’ll give us the upper hand. Pat pulls out the FOLDED NAPKIN, unfolds it. ON THE NAPKIN, in bleeding blue ink: ‘Fleischwolf’.

dialogues.speaker: SAM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Got something?

dialogues.speaker: PAT
dialogues.text: (showing napkin) 'Fleish...wolf’? Amber eyes Big Justin.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Fleish is flesh, or meat. Like a fleish salad. It’s German. With sausage.

dialogues.speaker: PAT
dialogues.text: Meat-wolf?  Pre-Production Draft v.2 (9/07/14) 49 Sam turns his attention as Tiger plops a DUSTY CEILING TI in his hands.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: (blowing breath) Careful! This could be asbestos... Tiger shoots back a look as Sam sets the tile down.

dialogues.speaker: TIGER
dialogues.text: All concrete.

dialogues.speaker: PAT
dialogues.text: Nothing here. He stands over the corpse, looks to Big Justin and tosses napkin.

dialogues.speaker: PAT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Empty your pockets.

dialogues.speaker: BIG JUSTIN
dialogues.text: Come search me, faggot.

dialogues.speaker: AMBER
dialogues.text: Just shoot him. Reece deadpans Big Justin.

dialogues.speaker: BIG JUSTIN
dialogues.text: Can I get up?

dialogues.speaker: REECE
dialogues.text: Just to your knees. Big Justin rocks his way out of the seated position, lumbering to his knees. Tiger moves into the bathroom, stands on the toilet to inspect the ceiling. Big Justin unsnaps his CHAIN WALLET, throws it forward. Digs in his pocket, throws some KEYS and BOTTLE CAPS.

dialogues.speaker: PAT
dialogues.text: Turn ‘em out. Big Justin deadpans Pat, digs out a BOX-CUTTER and throws forward.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Good call.  Pre-Production Draft v.2 (9/07/14) 50 He turns out his last pocket, cupping SOMETHING in his ha

dialogues.speaker: REECE PAT
dialogues.text: Is that..? Hand it ov- In one fluid motion, Big Justin reveals a FLIP-STYLE CELL PHONE, OPENS IT, SNAPS IT IN HALF and tosses it forward.

dialogues.speaker: SAM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (scrambling for the phone)

dialogues.speaker: BIG JUSTIN
dialogues.text: Oops. Reece grits his teeth, Pat curses himself.

dialogues.speaker: AMBER
dialogues.text: You piece of shit. Tiger steps from the bathroom. Sam pelts the phone halves Big Justin, who deflects with a shit-eating grin.

dialogues.speaker: TIGER
dialogues.text: Wait, was that-? TICK. THE ROOM GOES PITCH BLACK. MUFFLED, THROUGH THE DOOR: The amplified GRINDCORE DISINTEGRATES INTO SOLO DRUMS. Then STOPS. HOOTS AND HOLLERS FROM THE CROWD.

dialogues.speaker: SAM, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Is it the cops? A raid?

dialogues.speaker: AMBER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Are you serious?

dialogues.speaker: REECE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Shhhhhh...

dialogues.speaker: SAM, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Fuck off, Ilsa.

dialogues.speaker: REECE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Quiet. Don’t move, Justin. SCUFFLING.  Pre-Production Draft v.2 (9/07/14) 51

dialogues.speaker: PAT, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Aim at the door.

dialogues.speaker: REECE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Nobody move. MORE SCUFFLES. A CELLOPHANE CRINKLE.

dialogues.speaker: TIGER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: If we all get behi-

dialogues.speaker: REECE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Nobody talk! CHIK. Amber’s face in the WARM GLOW of LIGHTER FLAME. She LIGHTS A CIGARETTE. Puffs.

dialogues.speaker: AMBER
dialogues.text: Careful now... LIGHTER AFLAME, she walks to Big Justin, hands him the cigarette.

dialogues.speaker: AMBER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Smoke this.

dialogues.speaker: BIG JUSTIN
dialogues.text: Deal.

dialogues.speaker: AMBER
dialogues.text: If the cherry does something you don't like, shoot.

dialogues.speaker: REECE
dialogues.text: Thank you, Amber.

dialogues.speaker: AMBER
dialogues.text: Get comfortable. She leans to the wall. Reece puts forearms to knees, levels the gun. Sam nods. Pat too. Tiger sits, cradles his knees. The LIGHTER CLICKS OFF. Just the FLOATING CHERRY in the d And a FAINT COOL GLOW from the opposite corner of the roo Tiger crawls for a closer look...

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Pretty smart for a Nazi.  53 54 Pre-Production Draft v.2 (9/07/14) 52

dialogues.speaker: AMBER
dialogues.text: I’m not a Nazi. Tiger's eye hits a STRIPE OF DAYLIGHT spilling from under tattered carpet, near the base moulding.

dialogues.speaker: PAT
dialogues.text: Nazis weren’t necessarily stupid... just evil.

dialogues.speaker: TIGER
dialogues.text: Guys...

dialogues.speaker: AMBER
dialogues.text: You don’t know m-

dialogues.speaker: A COLLECTIVE ELECTRONIC WHIR AS THE LIGHTS FLICKER BACK O
dialogues.text: Tiger rips up the carpet, exposing a section of wood floo boards, but the daylight is now invisible. BROODING MUSIC BUILDS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE LAST RAYS OF SUN filter through the windows, some HOU LIGHTS STILL FLICKERING UP TO TEMPERATURE. FROM THE CROWD, Darcy crosses the stage and takes the mic

dialogues.speaker: DARCY
dialogues.text: (over PA) Looks like we tripped our main. Our back-up gennie is fired up but we're gonna to have to call ita day, do some troubleshooting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON THE GROCERY BAG Gabe removed from the Green Room, now Clark’s desk... Something inside BUZZES, GLOWS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pre-Production Draft v.2 (9/07/14) 53

dialogues.speaker: DARCY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: (over PA) We'll try it again next Sunday. No door charge. Hell, free drinks from two to four. (O.S.) THE CROWD CHEERS.

dialogues.speaker: DARCY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: (over PA) For those of you attending the racial advocacy workshop on Wednesday, assume it’s on until you hear otherwise. EXT. THE VENUE - LOT —- MAGIC HOUR c 54 DANIEL APPROACHES A CIRCLE of SKINS PASSING A JOINT, PUTS HAND ON A SHOULDER.

dialogues.speaker: DANIEL
dialogues.text: Who hasn’t smoked yet. Three die-hard skins with boots, braces and bomber jacket KYLE, JONATHAN and ALAN raise their hands.

dialogues.speaker: DARCY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: (over PA) Remember, this is a movement, not a party. Alright, stay safe, and Godspeed.

dialogues.speaker: A HAZE OF GLOWING DUST AS THE VISITOR'S PARKING LOT EMPTI
dialogues.text: Save an idling, BEAT-UP SEDAN with toxic EXHAUST. Werm, the Guitarist and the Drummer are inside smoking.  55 56 57 58 Pre-Production Draft v.2 (9/07/14) 54

dialogues.speaker: GABE
dialogues.text: You're not worried they’11l talk? Darcy shuts a SECURITY SAFE, turns to present two STAMPED BAGS of HEROIN.

dialogues.speaker: DARCY
dialogues.text: They've got priorities.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WALK AND TALK, Darcy and Gabe head for Cowcatchers’ sedan

dialogues.speaker: DARCY
dialogues.text: Tell them the party is on us if they hole up for a few days. Put this fire out first...

dialogues.speaker: GABE
dialogues.text: (reading stamp) ‘Grove Street’?

dialogues.speaker: DARCY
dialogues.text: My dope, nigger stamps- in case one of these meatheads gets booked for possession. (arriving at sedan) Let’s get y’all somewhere safe!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The conversion van is pushed along quiet dirt. A Skin hops in the open door and steers it to a stop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam eyes Tiger, crouching with a SHARPIE, drawing a large on the floorboards.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Treasure?

dialogues.speaker: TIGER
dialogues.text: Daylight. Underneath. Eyes find Amber. She shrugs ignorance. MUFFLED, THROUGH THE DOOR: ROLLING, SCUFFS and THUMPS.  Pre-Production Draft v.2 (9/07/14)

dialogues.speaker: REECE
dialogues.text: Our gear... KNOCK KNOCK.

dialogues.speaker: DARCY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: WE’RE LOADING YOU OUT.

dialogues.speaker: DARCY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: THEY’VE COME AND GONE. GOT A LITTLE COMPLICATED.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: We’re so fucked.

dialogues.speaker: I'M GETTING HOARSE.
dialogues.text: (clearing throat) Can you hear me at this volume?

dialogues.speaker: SAM PAT
dialogues.text: YES. Yes.

dialogues.speaker: DARCY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Good. And can we elect a single voice? Sam yields, Pat inches closer to the door.

dialogues.speaker: PAT
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: DARCY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: You are trapped. This is not a threat, just a fact.

dialogues.speaker: PAT
dialogues.text: (to door) We have the gun. Loaded. Also just a fact.

dialogues.speaker: DARCY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: We've got plenty more guns on hand, but we want you out, not harmed. 55  Pre-Production Draft v.2 (9/07/14) 56 Pat shoots a look back at the band.

dialogues.speaker: DARCY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: That firearm you have is not registered. I wanted it out of the picture before the authorities arrived. You refused, and so here we are...

dialogues.speaker: REECE
dialogues.text: (whispering) Bullshit. Pat looks for consensus, there is none.

dialogues.speaker: PAT
dialogues.text: (to door) ..-here we are.

dialogues.speaker: DARCY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: I do apologize for my associates. They panicked.

dialogues.speaker: PAT
dialogues.text: No shit! And we’re in a r-

dialogues.speaker: DARCY
dialogues.text: LISTEN. No one’s trying to wipe this clean. Whatever you saw or did is not now my concern. Tell whoever you want whatever you want. All I ask is that you understand you were held here for your own safety. Before you were let go. A crossfire of looks, a surge of hope.

dialogues.speaker: PAT
dialogues.text: (to door) Yes. Thank you. To be clear, the police are coming back?

dialogues.speaker: DARCY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: They have come and gone.

dialogues.speaker: PAT
dialogues.text: (to door) That’s what concerns us.

dialogues.speaker: DARCY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Just need that gun out of the picture...  Pre-Production Draft v.2 (9/07/14) 57 Pat crosses between Reece and Big Justin, towards the cen of the room.

dialogues.speaker: REECE
dialogues.text: (tipping gun barrel away) Careful. Sam and Tiger join Pat in the center, Amber hovers close. IN A HUDDLE, HUSHED.

dialogues.speaker: PAT
dialogues.text: What do we do?

dialogues.speaker: TIGER
dialogues.text: Dig through the floor.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: While they just wait? They could shoot us anytime.

dialogues.speaker: PAT
dialogues.text: But they haven't. How do we even know th-

dialogues.speaker: AMBER
dialogues.text: They have guns. No question.

dialogues.speaker: SHHH.
dialogues.text: We're going to trust you?

dialogues.speaker: REECE
dialogues.text: We've got zero leverage.

dialogues.speaker: AMBER
dialogues.text: Ask for a phone. For the gun. Pat considers, they all do.

dialogues.speaker: TIGER
dialogues.text: What about him? Big Justin, laying low in Reece’s sights.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Soon as we hand it over he'll...

dialogues.speaker: REECE
dialogues.text: I can tie him up.

dialogues.speaker: PAT
dialogues.text: Okay? See what they say?  Pre-Production Draft v.2 (9/07/14) 58 Nods from everyone as Pat approaches the door.

dialogues.speaker: PAT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (to door) We'll hand it over if you give us a cell phone.

dialogues.speaker: DARCY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Sorry, no.

dialogues.speaker: PAT
dialogues.text: (to door) How about a registered firearm?

dialogues.speaker: DARCY
dialogues.text: Funny. JUSTIN, YOU ALIVE AND WELL? Justin waits for approval. Reece nods.

dialogues.speaker: DARCY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Okay, good. I hope you gentlemen can appreciate the situation. Things have gone south, no doubt. But know that if you don’t hand that gun over, it won’t end well. You see, as far as I know, I come to my place of business and there's an out-of-town band, locked in a room with an unregistered firearm- and somebody’s hurt inside. Maybe even a hostage too?

dialogues.speaker: PAT
dialogues.text: (to door) C'mon... Tiger closes his eyes, Amber fumes, Reece keeps the gun o Big Justin, who cracks a smile.

dialogues.speaker: DARCY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: What am I to do? Am I within my rights to intervene? Should I kick down the door and start shooting? Or would it be safer to remove the guns from the equation? These are my questions. I’1l wait thirty seconds for an answer...

dialogues.speaker: PAT
dialogues.text: (to door) Hold on... (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pre-Production Draft v.2 (9/07/14) 59

dialogues.speaker: PAT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (turning to group) Anyone got smart ideas?

dialogues.speaker: REECE
dialogues.text: (smiles) Zero leverage. Reece hands the gun to Sam. REECE (CONT’D) Got it? Sam nods, sidesteps and crouches, pressing the gun to the base of Big Justin’s head.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Please don’t do anything. Reece scoots on the ground and snakes his limbs around Bi Justin’s torso, securing a tight arm bar.

dialogues.speaker: REECE
dialogues.text: He’s good.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Are we really doing this?

dialogues.speaker: TIGER
dialogues.text: This isn’t right.

dialogues.speaker: PAT
dialogues.text: No one’s saying it is. We either hand over the gun, or open fire with it.

dialogues.speaker: AMBER
dialogues.text: I vote for that. Sam gets to his feet, cradling the gun.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Your vote doesn’t count. We’re taking chances either way.

dialogues.speaker: TIGER
dialogues.text: (pacing wildly) We’re so dead... Pat intercepts Tiger’s orbit, grabs his shoulders.

dialogues.speaker: PAT
dialogues.text: At least this way we’ll find out. All we're doing now is buying time.  60 Pre-Production Draft v.2 (9/07/14)

dialogues.speaker: AMBER
dialogues.text: For them. Pat nods.

dialogues.speaker: REECE
dialogues.text: Amen. At this point I’m just fucking curious.. Tiger breathes, nods. Pat takes position by the door. Amb scans around the room.

dialogues.speaker: PAT
dialogues.text: (to door) Okay. We’1l hand it over. But we’re keeping the ammo.

dialogues.speaker: DARCY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: That's fine. Safer for everyone. Sam nods, inspects the revolver...

dialogues.speaker: PAT
dialogues.text: (to door) Step back, please.

dialogues.speaker: DARCY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: You got it. stands ready by the dead bolt. Pat scoots the couch back, Amber eyes a broken DRUM STICK in a wastebasket, plucks i out.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: (fiddling with gun) Where’s the-?

dialogues.speaker: PAT
dialogues.text: (holding out hand) Here. Sam hands over the Ruger, Pat finds the cylinder release latch and empties the .454 rounds into Sam’s cupped hands

dialogues.speaker: REECE
dialogues.text: (to Big Justin) Hold real still... Tiger and Sam get behind the couch. Amber hops over it, taking a prone position by the base of the door.  Pre-Production Draft v.2 (9/07/14) 61 She pokes the dislodged vent Big Justin kicked-in earlier with the drum stick, prying open a sliver-view into the hallway beyond. THROUGH THE SLIVER: Amber sees Darcy’s GENERIC COMFORT SH settling back against the far wall. Amber angles her head to see more...

dialogues.speaker: PAT
dialogues.text: Here we go. HE SLIDES THE DEAD-BOLT UNLOCKED. Puts his foot down in a sturdy stance, blows on his palms cracks the DOOR OPEN.

dialogues.speaker: PAT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Okay. Here.

dialogues.speaker: DARCY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: May I approach?

dialogues.speaker: PAT
dialogues.text: No. I’m throwing it.

dialogues.speaker: DARCY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Careful. It was a gift. Biting her lips, Amber watches THROUGH THE SLIVER: Darcy' shoes stay put... The big-bore snub nose needing more clearance, Pat adjust his posture, opens the door a bit further... As the door angles inward, Amber’s view widens. She crane her neck, hearing the SQUEAK of stiff leather... THROUGH THE SLIVER: JUST OUTSIDE THE DOOR...

dialogues.speaker: AMBER
dialogues.text: (whipping to Pat) THEY'RE KILLING US.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Keep the gun! A HAND THRUSTS INSIDE, GRABS PAT’S WRIST.

dialogues.speaker: PAT
dialogues.text: Get off!  Pre-Production Draft v.2 (9/07/14) 62

dialogues.speaker: PAT
dialogues.text: Okay, okay, okay, okay!

dialogues.speaker: SENDING AMBER FLINCHING BACK AS HER VIEW IS CAVED-IN.
dialogues.text: Immediately, RHYTHMIC HACKING SOUNDS. PAT SCREAMS, fighting for leverage, pressing the door aga his own arm. BIG JUSTIN BUCKS, CATCHING REECE OFF GUARD.

dialogues.speaker: THE FUCK OFF ME...
dialogues.text: Pat jolts from off screen IMPACTS. Amber scrambles to her feet as Sam rushes to the door.

dialogues.speaker: AHHHHHHHHH.
dialogues.text: Amber and Sam grab Pat around the waist, heaving.

dialogues.speaker: ON METAL IMPACTS.
dialogues.text: They pull Pat inside, HIS HAND NEARLY HACKED-OFF ABOVE TH WRIST. Reece barrels into the door, slamming it shut, twisting around and locking the bolt.

dialogues.speaker: REECE
dialogues.text: Holy fuck. Pat crumples to the ground, hunched over his wound.

dialogues.speaker: PAT
dialogues.text: Oh god. Oh no...oh god...  Pre-Production Draft v.2 (9/07/14) 63 Two POUNDS on the door.

dialogues.speaker: DARCY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: (through door) THIS’LL BE OVER SOON, GENTLEMEN. Big Justin staggers to his feet, HIS SNAPPED ARM DANGLING HIS SIDE.

dialogues.speaker: BIG JUSTIN
dialogues.text: ..-fucking crush you... AMBER charges Big Justin, he winds-up his good arm... THWAK. CLOTHES-LINES HER TO THE FLOOR. Tiger sprawls, pushing the couch back against the door. BIG JUSTIN (CONT’D)

dialogues.speaker: WHORES
dialogues.text: He goes for the BOX-CUTTER, Reece JUMPS ON HIS BACK, SECU A NECK CHOKE.

dialogues.speaker: REECE
dialogues.text: Get it! Big Justin staggers, in shock with no air, thumbing at th slide of his box-cutter. THE BLADE EXTENDS, BIG JUSTIN BLINDLY SLASHES AT REECE. AMBER GOES FOR THE WEAPON, GRABBING BIG JUSTIN'S WRIST.

dialogues.speaker: REECE CONSTRICTS WITH ALL HIS MIGHT AND JUSTIN FLUSHES RE
dialogues.text: Amber wrestles the box-cutter away. Tiger sits facing Pat, registering the severity of his wounds: BLOOD, EXPOSED FAT, THE HAND SAGGING BY TENDONS.

dialogues.speaker: PAT
dialogues.text: Okayokayokayokay... Sam turns to Pat. Reece wraps his legs around Big Justin, now twitching helplessly, biting the air.

dialogues.speaker: REECE
dialogues.text: Tell me when he’s out!  Pre-Production Draft v.2 (9/07/14) 64

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: (turning back) Okay... Tiger unlaces his battered Chuck Taylors. Big Justin's eyes go glassy and roll back.

dialogues.speaker: SAM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: He’s out. Reece holds several seconds, loosens his grip. Big Justin sags to the ground. OUTSIDE THE DOOR, MUFFLED MUSIC RESUMES OVER THE PA. Tiger pulls a striped tube sock from his foot.

dialogues.speaker: TIGER
dialogues.text: Here... Tiger wraps the tube sock above Pat’s elbow, tightens a k Pat GRUNTS/SOBS/SPITS.

dialogues.speaker: REECE
dialogues.text: Tie it so there’s enough- Big Justin JOLTS RIGID AND PLANKS OUT. Startled, Tiger whips to see... BRAYING EXHALATIONS PUSH FOAMING SPIT through Big Justin' clenched teeth and flapping jowls.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: He’s not out.

dialogues.speaker: REECE
dialogues.text: Fuck this. Reece wraps Big Justin up in a rear-naked choke. Big Justin comes to, locks eyes with Pat, glazing over.

dialogues.speaker: BIG JUSTIN
dialogues.text: (whispering) +.-Me too...

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: (to Tiger) We got this! Put pressure on that.  Pre-Production Draft v.2 (9/07/14) 65 Tiger removes his jacket, wraps it around Pat’s mangled a Amber, box-cutter in hand, steps to Reece.

dialogues.speaker: AMBER
dialogues.text: You got it?

dialogues.speaker: REECE
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: BIG JUSTIN
dialogues.text: (whispering) .-Shoulda...locked...door...

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Are we doing this? Amber crouches, face to face with Big Justin.

dialogues.speaker: AMBER
dialogues.text: (whispering back) Problem wasn’t locking the door. Problem was killing my friend. Reece settles in. And squeezes. They watch. His regulated breaths. The tears streaming down his cheeks. Until it's done.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: How long does it take? To be sure? Shrugs, looks. Amber RUNS THE BOX-CUTTER UP BIG JUSTIN’S BELLY.

dialogues.speaker: REECE
dialogues.text: (releases grip) Jesus. Tiger winces, looks to the door, dazed.

dialogues.speaker: TIGER
dialogues.text: We...need... Pat clutching his wound, blood seeping through the jacket.  59 Pre-Production Draft v.2 (9/07/14) 66

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: You said you saw daylight?

dialogues.speaker: TIGER
dialogues.text: What? Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A stenciled ‘Ain't Rights’ logo lands into frame. Daniel stacks BRANDED CASES in the conversion van. SLAMMING the rear doors, he finds Gabe waiting with a MIL CRATE: inside, the BLOOD-SPATTERED .454 RUGER.

dialogues.speaker: DARCY
dialogues.text: Any and all firearms. Clark will handle it from here... (to Gabe) He give you an ETA?

dialogues.speaker: GABE
