dialogues.text: I told him no calls.

dialogues.speaker: DARCY
dialogues.text: Right. Good. (re: milk crate) Phones too... The Skins gather, Daniel sees the BLOODY MACHETE.

dialogues.speaker: DANIEL
dialogues.text: What happened in there? A .25 CAL AUTO and a .38 SNUBNOSE are placed in the crate followed by three CELL PHONES.

dialogues.speaker: DARCY
dialogues.text: (to Gabe) Set up Neil for tomorrow. New drywall, pour a floor. Say we had a leak. Gabe nods. Darcy checks his watch.

dialogues.speaker: DANIEL
dialogues.text: What happened?

dialogues.speaker: DARCY
dialogues.text: (to Gabe) Door with a frame too. I’ve got carpet on hand- (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 60 Pre-Production Draft v.2 (9/07/14) 67

dialogues.speaker: DARCY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (to Daniel) Bit of a maelstrom tonight. Gabe and Darcy exchange looks. Darcy motions the Skins cl

dialogues.speaker: DARCY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Visiting band... (gestures to the van) ..-hurt one of ours.

dialogues.speaker: DANIEL
dialogues.text: Who? Gabe steps in, calming...

dialogues.speaker: GABE
dialogues.text: Emily.

dialogues.speaker: DARCY
dialogues.text: Maybe Big Justin too.

dialogues.speaker: DANIEL
dialogues.text: (fury in his eyes) What the fuck are we doing? Let’s-

dialogues.speaker: DARCY
dialogues.text: We are not coming apart is what we are doing. We are saving questions until this pig-fuck is transferred off site-

dialogues.speaker: GABE
dialogues.text: Darcy. Off Gabe’s nod, Darcy steps back and looks off: THROUGH THE TREES, PICKUP TRUCK HEADLIGHTS. Faintly, the CRUNCH of gravel, RATTLING, BARKING. Daniel swallows, intense.

dialogues.speaker: DARCY
dialogues.text: Last chance if anyone needs to take a leak...

dialogues.speaker: PULLING OUT FROM THE LOCKED GREEN ROOM DOOR...
dialogues.text: Outside, MUFFLED MUSIC... Inside, a RUCKUS...  Pre-Production Draft v.2 (9/07/14) 68 THEY’RE TEARING THE PLACE APART. Tiger, standing over the Sharpie ‘X’, PUMMELING FLOORBOAR with a MIC STAND. Amber SMASHING WALLS, EXPOSING BRICK. Sam, STABBING CEILING TILES with the aluminum frame, his shirt pulled over his nose. Reece drapes Big Justin’s jacket over his corpse.

dialogues.speaker: PAT
dialogues.text: I lost the gun...

dialogues.speaker: REECE
dialogues.text: You held on longer than I would've. Pat gives a drowsy smile. Reece turns to the rest. REECE (CONT’D) I'M GOING. Sam, Tiger and Amber keep up the DEMO.

dialogues.speaker: REECE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: There’s no air shaft, no sewer sys-— SMASH.

dialogues.speaker: TIGER
dialogues.text: There we go... COOL LIGHT SPILLS up through a caved-in floorboard. Amber turns, watches Tiger and Sam peel up carpet.

dialogues.speaker: PAT
dialogues.text: What time is it?

dialogues.speaker: AMBER
dialogues.text: That's not daylight.

dialogues.speaker: TIGER
dialogues.text: It’s something... Reece SMASHES a chair, yanks off a leg, crosses... Reece drives the chair leg into the floor, STOMPS several times, BREAKING THROUGH. Sam and Tiger swoop in, prying away loose boards.  61 62 63 Pre-Production Draft v.2 (9/07/14) 69 Sam, Tiger and Reece gaze down a PORTAL OF SPLINTERED WOO AND FLOATING PARTICLES.

dialogues.speaker: INDUSTRIAL WHIR...
dialogues.text: Tiger is lowered into frame, past a DANGLING FLUORESCENT FIXTURE, surveying the interior.

dialogues.speaker: TIGER
dialogues.text: Oh. Reece drops down behind him. Then Sam. Before them is a near century-old alcove. MODERN PLUMBING FIXTURES tapped into the old WATER MAIN lead to a moderni insulated room. ABOVE: SPRINKLERS and VENTILATION. BELOW: TARPED LAB EQUIPMENT, INDUSTIRAL TUBS and MIXERS.

dialogues.speaker: REECE
dialogues.text: Look for a door. Sam, Tiger and Reece spread out, rushing down the narrow isles between the equipment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amber, looking down the jagged hole in the floor. To Pat, huddled against the wall with labored breaths.

dialogues.speaker: PAT
dialogues.text: Just let me know. Amber sits, readying to drop.

dialogues.speaker: PAT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Sorry about your friend. She nods, shoves off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam pulls a plastic curtain: behind it, TANKS, CLIMATE CONTROL UNITS and SUPPLY SHELVING mounted on CONCRETE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 63 Pre-Production Draft v.2 (9/07/14) 70

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Nope. Reece rips away insulation, revealing RIBBED METAL WALLS.

dialogues.speaker: REECE
dialogues.text: Containers. Tiger parts heavy plastic sheeting and crosses into an 8x chamber housing INDUSTRIAL COFFEE GRINDERS, SCALES, AND B OF POWDER. At the far end, a LADDER LEADS TO A CEILING HA He sprints up it and grabs the welded handle. Doesn’t bud

dialogues.speaker: TIGER
dialogues.text: Shit! Tiger drops down, Reece climbs up, gives it a try, POUNDS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Set twenty feet from the back of the venue, a charred, disused BARBECUE PIT. FAINT METALLIC THUMPS from underneath...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reece drops down from the latch.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: There a lock?

dialogues.speaker: REECE
dialogues.text: Other side maybe. We’re burning time. Sam tilts his gaze to the duct work above.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: There’s ven- Reece is gone. Sam and Tiger jog after him... They push through the sheeting, crossing back.

dialogues.speaker: SAM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: There’s ventilation!

dialogues.speaker: REECE
dialogues.text: Four inch ducts. Good luck.  64 Pre-Production Draft v.2 (9/07/14) 71 Amber stands by the entrance, taking in the operation. Tiger pulls back the plastic curtain, eyeing a roll of REFLECTIVE DUCT TAPE on the shelf.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Shouldn’t we look around? Reece kneels, offering Amber a boost.

dialogues.speaker: REECE
dialogues.text: We just did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amber pops back up through the floor. ON PAT, eager.

dialogues.speaker: AMBER
dialogues.text: (getting to her feet) Heroin. This isn’t about her...us. Reece surfaces, reaches back for Sam and Tiger.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: _ (popping up) Big ass bunker.

dialogues.speaker: REECE
dialogues.text: Big ass dead end. Pat sinks, Tiger knee-slides to his side.

dialogues.speaker: TIGER
dialogues.text: Gimme your hand... Tiger pulls the jacket from around PAT’S HAND: EXPOSED TENDONS, LOSING BLOOD FAST. Pat grits his teeth.

dialogues.speaker: TIGER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Look away, dude...

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Can’t we use this to our advantage?

dialogues.speaker: WE'RE DONE
dialogues.text: (fights for composure) I’m done. Close the door behind me if you wanna strategize.  Pre-Production Draft v.2 (9/07/14) 72 Tiger yanks a length of DUCT TAPE from the roll, wraps th wound...

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: We're not ready.

dialogues.speaker: REECE
dialogues.text: What do you think they're doing?

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: That’s just it, we don’t know. Tiger winds the tape roll ‘round and ‘round, eyes welling

dialogues.speaker: REECE
dialogues.text: We know they mean us harm.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: It’s just- if they have guns why aren't they mowing us down? Amber pockets the box-cutter, kneels by Emily’s corpse.

dialogues.speaker: PAT
dialogues.text: ...can’t just go missing. They need us found...

dialogues.speaker: AMBER
dialogues.text: Grab some shit, get ready to run.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: We'll die... Reece picks up the wooden chair leg.

dialogues.speaker: REECE
dialogues.text: The longer we wait the surer that is. Ready? Tiger? Amber kisses Emily's forehead, covers her up.

dialogues.speaker: TIGER
dialogues.text: (tears streaming) Almost... Tiger winds the tape...

dialogues.speaker: PAT
dialogues.text: We gotta treat this like paintball. Eyes on Pat. Even Amber wants to hear this.

dialogues.speaker: PAT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Can’t take it so seriously...  Pre-Production Draft v.2 (9/07/14) 73

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Say what?

dialogues.speaker: PAT
dialogues.text: Rick Silva. He organized the paint ball for Skate-o’s bachelor party? Let me tag along. We were short a few players to book the whole field, so they paired us with these ex-Marines. First two games, they tore us to shreds. Zero casualties on their side- I just cowered behind trees until I was shot-

dialogues.speaker: REECE
dialogues.text: Tiger- you done? Tiger tears and smooths the duct tape, PAT’S HAND AND FOR NOW MUMMIFIED IN A METALLIC SHEEN.

dialogues.speaker: TIGER
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: REECE
dialogues.text: (to Pat) Gotta go. Sorry.

dialogues.speaker: PAT
dialogues.text: Okay. Amber fishes the box-cutter from her pocket.

dialogues.speaker: AMBER
dialogues.text: Was that a pep talk? Tiger blows a snot-laugh, wipes his tears. Sam grabs the 4’ fluorescent bulb.

dialogues.speaker: REECE
dialogues.text: We won’t all live, but- I dunno- maybe we won't all die... Tiger lifts the aluminum ceiling frame, offers it to Pat, cradling his wounded arm.

dialogues.speaker: PAT
dialogues.text: (waving it off) I’m just gonna run.

dialogues.speaker: WEAPONS READY...
dialogues.text: Pre-Production Draft v.2 (9/07/14)

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Fuck it. Simon and Garfunkel. Heads turn, furrowed brows.

dialogues.speaker: SAM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: ‘Desert island’ band.

dialogues.speaker: REECE
dialogues.text: Ha. Prince. They look to Pat...

dialogues.speaker: TIGER
dialogues.text: Still the Misfits.

dialogues.speaker: REECE
dialogues.text: (with a nod) True school.

dialogues.speaker: AMBER
dialogues.text: We going? Nods. PUSHING IN ON THE DOOR... The MUFFLED MUSIC. Reece puts a hand on the deadbolt, looks back. Battle positions. Sam taps the fluorescent bulb to the ground. POP. Raises ‘business end’ of jagged glass.

dialogues.speaker: REECE
dialogues.text: Here we go...

dialogues.speaker: AMBER
dialogues.text: (under her breath) Madonna and Slayer... SHE THUMBS OUT THE BOX CUTTER BLADE...

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Watchit. 74  65 66 Pre-Production Draft v.2 (9/07/14) 75 SAM JAVELIN-THROWS THE JAGGED FLUORESCENT BULB...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE 4’ BULB SPEARS THROUGH THE AIR, IMPACTS THE FAR WALL EXPLODES INTO SHARDS AS THEY CHARGE THOUGH THE THRESHOLD. ..-INTO AN EMPTY HALLWAY.

dialogues.speaker: TIGER
dialogues.text: (hushed) What the fuck?

dialogues.speaker: PAT
dialogues.text: (re: their gear) They loaded us out.

dialogues.speaker: REECE
dialogues.text: (to Amber) How many exits?

dialogues.speaker: AMBER
dialogues.text: (pointing) The main, the back, maybe the kitchen? I alwa-

dialogues.speaker: TIGER
dialogues.text: What about windows?

dialogues.speaker: AMBER
dialogues.text: See for yourself. Reece has crept halfway down the hall. They follow...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As they reach the stage stairs, THE PA MUSIC FADES DOWN. Suddenly, eerily quiet. They crouch and find shadows, scanning the interior. Just darkness. SCUFFLING FOOTSTEPS. A SUBTLE CREAK.

dialogues.speaker: TIGER
dialogues.text: Should we hide?  67 Pre-Production Draft v.2 (9/07/14) 76

dialogues.speaker: REECE
dialogues.text: Whatever you want. Reece descends the stairs, jogs crouched towards the main entrance. Tiger, Sam, Amber and Pat follow.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: We should split up.

dialogues.speaker: TIGER
dialogues.text: Totally. No one breaks from the cluster. As they round the bar, waiting in the doorway: CLARK in silhouette, a BREAK STICK in one hand- in the ot a ROPE LEAD tethered to BROWNIE, an eighty-pound PIT BULL Lean, grizzled, panting eagerly.

dialogues.speaker: FASS
dialogues.text: He CLINKS a collar chain free and the PIT BULL (BROWNIE) bullets towards the crew. They scramble. Reece pivots, hops over the bar. Leaving Tiger exposed, frozen... THE PIT BULL (BROWNIE) RUNS TIGER DOWN AND GOES TO WORK. Amber breaks for the stage, rolls onto it. Sam sprints back up the stage stairs. Pat hobbles after.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FOLLOWING REECE down a corridor of industrial kitchen equipment, towards an exit door. He glides to a stop, tries the latch- locked. He sidestep an adjacent TOP-HINGED WINDOW, quietly pushes it open and slips outside...

dialogues.speaker: REPEATEDLY TO THE GROUND WITH A CLEAVER.
dialogues.text: 68 69 Pre-Production Draft v.2 (9/07/14) 77

dialogues.speaker: OH SHIT
dialogues.text: Gabe pulls Alan back.

dialogues.speaker: GABE
dialogues.text: Save it. Reece slumps to the ground with glazed eyes, BLEEDING OUT Gabe searches his pockets.

dialogues.speaker: NECK.
dialogues.text: Clark steps up, WHAPPING BROWNIE with his break stick.

dialogues.speaker: CLARK
dialogues.text: Aus! Aus! BROWNIE releases, lapping blood, tongue swinging. CLARK (CONT’D) Las es... VORAN! HOLD ON TIGER, his drifting eyes catch something... STRAPPED UNDER THE BAR COUNTER: A SAWED-OFF PUMP SHOTGUN. ON TIGER: just an observer now, calmly nearing lifelessne

dialogues.speaker: THE PIT BULL, (BROWNIE)
dialogues.text: Amber launches from behind a speaker stack, sprints acros

dialogues.speaker: BROWNIE EFFORTLESSLY MAKES THE FOUR FOOT LEAP UP THE STAG
dialogues.text: HE BRIDGES THE DISTANCE IN SECONDS, CLAMPING ON AMBER’S L

dialogues.speaker: AHHHWWW...
dialogues.text: She crumples to the stage floor, BROWNIE SINKS HIS BITE A THRASHES .  70 Pre-Production Draft v.2 (9/07/14) 78

dialogues.speaker: CLARK
dialogues.text: (keeping his distance)

dialogues.speaker: FASS
dialogues.text: Amber topples a MIC STAND and starts BLUDGEONING BROWNIE its WEIGHTED BASE. Little effect. As she thrusts and winds up, the attached MICROPHONE cont the FLOOR MONITOR SPEAKER, causing FEEDBACK SURGES. BROWNIE twitches at the sound, anxiously finds new footin BETWEEN AMBER’S JABS, A HAND REACHES DOWN BEHIND HER, SNATCHING THE MICROPHONE FROM THE STAND. IT’S PAT, scared shitless. He presses the microphone to t monitor. The FEEDBACK SWELLS TO AN EAR-SPLITTING FREQUENCY.

dialogues.speaker: AMBER CLUNKS HIM ON THE HEAD AND HE SCAMPERS OFF.
dialogues.text: Amber, spent, looks back to Pat, the SCREECHING FEEDBACK music to their ears. Taped below the monitor is COWCATCHER’S SET LIST. Pat crinkles a brow, peels it up.

dialogues.speaker: FEEDBACK, FARTHER AWAY.
dialogues.text: Sam unhooks a wall-mounted FIRE EXTINGUISHER. Fumbling, h snaps the plastic seal around the trigger pin. He creeps along, settling at the back entrance. He pulls the safety pin. Crouching, he kicks open the doo SCUFFLING.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Fuck! COUGHING AND GASPING AS KYLE’S MACHETE BLADE CUTS THROUGH BILLOWING CLOUD AND CLANKS AGAINST THE DOOR.  71 72 Pre-Production Draft v.2 (9/07/14) 79

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Shit! Sam kicks back, dragging the extinguisher, crawling to a The door SLAMS behind him. A MUFFLED EXCHANGE OUTSIDE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pat and Amber converge with Sam at the Green Room. Sam grips the extinguisher, Amber the mic stand.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: They’re everywhere- you see Reece? Amber and Pat solemnly shake their heads. THE FEEDBACK PERSISTS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam, Amber and Pat drop their gear and shove the couch against the battered door.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Here we are... Pat picks the napkin off Emily’s corpse, hands Sam the COWCATCHER SET LIST.

dialogues.speaker: PAT
dialogues.text: Third one down.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: (reading set list) Fleish..wo- Fleischwolf? Pat holds up the napkin: ‘Fleischwolf’. They look to Amber.

dialogues.speaker: AMBER
dialogues.text: It’s a song.

dialogues.speaker: PAT
dialogues.text: Agreed.

dialogues.speaker: AMBER
dialogues.text: .»..means ‘meat-grinder’.  Pre-Production Draft v.2 (9/07/14)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 80 73 Darcy pacing, Clark leading the BLOOD-BATHED PIT (BROWNIE the tailgate of his truck and into a CRATE.

dialogues.speaker: CLARK
dialogues.text: (patting dog) So ist brav...

dialogues.speaker: DARCY
dialogues.text: You retiring him?

dialogues.speaker: CLARK
dialogues.text: He’s worked up.

dialogues.speaker: DARCY
dialogues.text: Send another. Send two. Finish it.

dialogues.speaker: CLARK
dialogues.text: Kill that feedback first. (locking crate) And if I send in two fighting dogs, whaddya think they’1l do? Darcy digests that thought, Daniel steps up.

dialogues.speaker: DANIEL
dialogues.text: Send me in there. I'll finish up. Darcy considers.

dialogues.speaker: DANIEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Just give me the rules.

dialogues.speaker: CLARK
dialogues.text: Alright. Blades only. Sloppy is fine, but try not to hit the bone.

dialogues.speaker: DANIEL
dialogues.text: (already moving) Okay.

dialogues.speaker: DARCY
dialogues.text: Take Jonathan. Jonathan joins Daniel, they clasp hands.

dialogues.speaker: JONATHAN
dialogues.text: Brute squad.

dialogues.speaker: DANIEL
dialogues.text: (to Clark) Keep them caged ‘till we tag out?  74 75 Pre-Production Draft v.2 (9/07/14)

dialogues.speaker: AROUND THE SIDE
dialogues.text: Gabe rounds the corner, pulling REECE’S BODY 81 by the feet. He spots Daniel and Jonathan heading into the venue, mach in hand.

dialogues.speaker: DARCY
dialogues.text: (re: the body) He breathing?

dialogues.speaker: GABE
dialogues.text: (turning) Little, yeah.

dialogues.speaker: DARCY
dialogues.text: Let him bleed- later is better with time of death. Keys? Gabe shakes‘no’.

dialogues.speaker: RINGING, DISTORTED FEEDBACK...
dialogues.text: 74 TRACKING BEHIND DANIEL AND JONATHAN, MACHETES IN HAND... Moving fluidly past the bar, Daniel goes straight for the green room, Jonathan hops onto the stage, yanks the microphone from the monitor speaker and kills the switch.

dialogues.speaker: THE FEEDBACK STOPS.
dialogues.text: Sam, Amber and Pat look to the door.

dialogues.speaker: AMBER
dialogues.text: They’re coming. MUFFLED FOOTSTEPS up the hallway...

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: I can't do this... PFFUMP. PFFUMP. CRACK. The door is succumbing to BOOT STRIKES. Sam readies his fire extinguisher, Pat steps Amber grips the mic stand. 75 back.  Pre-Production Draft v.2 (9/07/14) 82 PFFUMP. CRUNCH. SPLINTERING AROUND THE DEADBOLT. CRACK! DANIEL BUSTS THE DOOR OPEN, sliding the couch inwa SAM FIRES HIS EXTINGUISHER, FORCING DANIEL BACK. The CLOUD envelops the room. ZERO VISIBILITY. They hear Daniel SCUFFLING his way back inside.

dialogues.speaker: GET BACK
dialogues.text: SAM FIRES ANOTHER JET OF RETARDANT, but Daniel is on him snatches the extinguisher away. DANIEL KICKS SAM TO THE FLOOR.

dialogues.speaker: WHERE'S EMILY
dialogues.text: Daniel wafts the air, sweeps the ground, pulling the jack off BIG JUSTIN’S GUTTED CORPSE.

dialogues.speaker: AMBER
dialogues.text: Daniel! Jonathan enters, thrown off, the CLOUD settling.

dialogues.speaker: JONATHAN
dialogues.text: Fuck are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: PAT
dialogues.text: He’s the one... Pat holds up the napkin, looks to Amber.

dialogues.speaker: PAT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: ..+.-gave her this. Daniel pulls the blanket off EMILY’S CORPSE.

dialogues.speaker: JONATHAN
dialogues.text: Hey! Daniel white-knuckles the machete, acknowledging Amber.

dialogues.speaker: DANIEL
dialogues.text: Which one did it?

dialogues.speaker: AMBER
dialogues.text: Werm did it.  Pre-Production Draft v.2 (9/07/14) 83

dialogues.speaker: DANIEL
dialogues.text: Bullshit. Which one? Sam COUGHS, covered in fire retardant, disappears down th hole in the floor. Jonathan observes with mounting confus

dialogues.speaker: AMBER
dialogues.text: What’d they tell you, Daniel? Daniel, dead-eyed.

dialogues.speaker: AMBER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You want to know? (nodding to Jonathan) You want him to know?

dialogues.speaker: JONATHAN
dialogues.text: Know what? Amber putting it together.

dialogues.speaker: AMBER
dialogues.text: Werm found out she was leaving. She didn’t say it was with you- during the show. (turning to Pat) Meatgrinder. The song was their cue. All eyes on Daniel.

dialogues.speaker: DANIEL
dialogues.text: (turning to Jonathan) You should go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darcy paces, Clark leads another PIT BULL (JD) from its c

dialogues.speaker: DARCY
dialogues.text: They're taking too long. Darcy walks to Gabe, TARPING REECE’S BODY NEXT TO TIGER’S

dialogues.speaker: DARCY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You didn’t want Daniel on door duty. Why?

dialogues.speaker: GABE
dialogues.text: Nothing concrete. He... and Emily. Darcy does an about-face...  77 78 Pre-Production Draft v.2 (9/07/14) 84

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON THE VISOR OF DANIEL’S ‘65 RAGTOP. Darcy flips it down, catches the keys. TRACKING WITH HIM AS HE OPENS THE TRUNK.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE TRUNK
dialogues.text: Packed to the hilt with BOXES, BEDDING, RECORDS, ARTIFACT ONE SIDE: HIS. ONE SIDE: HERS. Darcy swipes a FRAMED PICTURE from one of the boxes. THE PICTURE: Emily and friends, way back when.

dialogues.speaker: DARCY
dialogues.text: Little love birds... Darcy reaches to shut the trunk, notices something tucked deep inside, pulls it out... AN ALUMINUM BASEBALL BAT, WRAPPED IN A CLEAR GARBAGE BAG. It's weathered, spattered with DRIED, FLAKING BLOOD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darcy approaches Gabe with the bat, still wrapped in the Gabe frozen with dread.

dialogues.speaker: DARCY
dialogues.text: Recognize this?

dialogues.speaker: GABE
dialogues.text: No sir.

dialogues.speaker: DARCY
dialogues.text: Course not. You were handing out leaflets when these boys made their bones. (offering the bat) It’s from last Easter. And it was supposed to disappear after the boot party... Jonathan pushes out the exit, walking briskly with his machete, dusted with FIRE RETARDANT.  79 80 Pre-Production Draft v.2 (9/07/14) 85

dialogues.speaker: JONATHAN
dialogues.text: He just started talking? Amber's alive, saying Werm did it-

dialogues.speaker: DARCY
dialogues.text: (to Jonathan) Never mind that. Darcy steps to Gabe...

dialogues.speaker: DARCY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You... ...and kisses his forehead.

dialogues.speaker: DARCY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: ...Werm- just saved us all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pat is lowered by his good arm from the hole above, his f hit the floor.

dialogues.speaker: PAT
dialogues.text: Sam? Just the empty lab.

dialogues.speaker: PAT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It’s okay. Amber drops down behind him. Then Daniel.

dialogues.speaker: PAT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I mean, it’s not okay, but he’s with us. We gotta split. Pat continues towards the adjacent shipping container. Daniel takes in the operation.

dialogues.speaker: AMBER
dialogues.text: You didn’t know either.

dialogues.speaker: DANIEL
dialogues.text: Not where.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pat steps in, finds Sam sizing up an INDUSTRIAL FAN.  81 Pre-Production Draft v.2 (9/07/14) 86

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: This has a wider duct. I think. (turning) Reece was full of shit. Sam, swollen puffy eyes.

dialogues.speaker: PAT
dialogues.text: We won’t fit through there...

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Signed with Battletorn. That’s why he was so pressed. All his calls- lining up a big winter tour...

dialogues.speaker: PAT
dialogues.text: Daniel can help.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Why? Who’s he?

dialogues.speaker: DANIEL
dialogues.text: (stepping in) A traitor. If they didn’t already know, they know now. I can get us out.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Wow, a conspiracy?

dialogues.speaker: DANIEL
dialogues.text: No, just a clusterfuck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darcy addresses the crew, Clark paces with his PIT (JD).

dialogues.speaker: DARCY
dialogues.text: Light has been shed. Daniel and Emily, it appears, had ill intentions... Darcy holds up the bat. Some MURMURS from the Skins.

dialogues.speaker: DARCY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: So it is with renewed vigor we will see this through. Everything is at stake, and for us all. Gabe presents the milk crate, the Skins retrieve the .25 AUTO, the .38 SNUBNOSE. Darcy picks up the .454 RUGER.  82 83 Pre-Production Draft v.2 (9/07/14) 87

dialogues.speaker: DARCY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We're still blades and fangs for the visitors, but we’re getting lean on time. If you have to shoot- shoot once. More than once- keep a tight grouping cuz you'll be digging the slugs out yourself. As for Daniel and Am- wait... Gabe uncaps a pen, ready to amend his POST-IT. Darcy turn the Bartender, taps him on the chest.

dialogues.speaker: DARCY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: ..-what did we forget?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daniel leads Amber, Sam and Pat along the hall...

dialogues.speaker: THEM, WEAPONS OUT
dialogues.text: Daniel, THE MACHETE. Amber, THE MIC STAND. Sam, THE EXTINGUISHER. Pat, THE BOX CUTTER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They descend the stairs...

dialogues.speaker: DANIEL
dialogues.text: There’s a river on two sides, the quarry on another. We can parallel the main road back, go for help.

dialogues.speaker: AMBER
dialogues.text: How do we get past the door? Daniel veers off, circles behind the bar.

dialogues.speaker: DANIEL
dialogues.text: I know something you don’t... Daniel sets his machete atop the bar, runs his hand underneath, tosses up a FEW SHOTGUN SHELLS...

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Good. What? Sam watches a SHELL roll along the bar and CLINK AGAINST DARCY'S UNTOUCHED SHOT GLASS. He downs it.  Pre-Production Draft v.2 (9/07/14) 88

dialogues.speaker: DANIEL
dialogues.text: ...I know where we kee- BOOM. DANIEL’S SKULL COMES APART IN A BLAST OF BUCKSHOT, BODY BUCKLES AND FALLS. PAT JUMPS, DROPS THE BOX-CUTTER. SAM, SPLATTERED IN GORE, DROPS THE SHOT GLASS.

dialogues.speaker: BARTENDER
dialogues.text: Too slow... The Bartender floats from the shadows, PUMPS A SAWED-OFF SHOTGUN and sweeps it towards Amber. She ducks, DEFLECTS WITH THE MIC STAND. BOOM. THE WALL EXPLODES.

dialogues.speaker: POWDER.
dialogues.text: PAT GRABS DANIEL’S MACHETE FROM THE BAR, SWINGS IT REFLEXIVELY INTO THE BARTENDER’S NECK AND BACK. The Bartender shrugs, the gun sagging in his grip. HIS PRISTINE, POWDERED NECK GAPES OPEN AND BELCHES BLOOD.

dialogues.speaker: PAT
dialogues.text: Oh dear... Amber gently takes the shotgun, aims it back... But he’s already sliding into his own pool of blood, mout GURGLED WORDS.

dialogues.speaker: AMBER
dialogues.text: (to Pat) Thank- CRASH. The kitchen door slams open. Sam and Amber trade g looks as they back away. Pat pockets some SHOT SHELLS off the bar. A CLANK. The PATTER of paws scraping against concrete. Amber bears down on the main entrance. CLARK rounds the corner with the PIT (JD), flinches at th sight of Amber’s raised shotgun, YANKING THE DOG back out sight.  84 Pre-Production Draft v.2 (9/07/14) 89

dialogues.speaker: AMBER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (turning back) Should we go? Now? CLANK. MUFFLED YELLING from the back hall.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: We have a gun. I guess?

dialogues.speaker: PAT
dialogues.text: Yes?

dialogues.speaker: AMBER
dialogues.text: (to Pat) Gimme two! Pat hands over two SHOT SHELLS, Amber loads as she walks. Sam and Pat follow in line, gaining momentum until they S IN UNISON TOWARDS THE EXIT...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DARCY (CONT’D) NOT HIM- DON’T FIRE! FROM THE FLANK, CLARK RELEASES HIS PIT (JD) WITH A SMACK.

dialogues.speaker: FAS
dialogues.text: 85 86 Pre-Production Draft v.2 (9/07/14) 90

dialogues.speaker: PAT
dialogues.text: SAM! Come on! FUMBLING, SAM PUMPS THE ACTION AND AIMS FOR THE DOG. BOOM. JD LOOSES A HUNK OF FLESH BUT DOESN’T MISS A STEP.

dialogues.speaker: THE DOOR SWINGS SHUT.
dialogues.text: Pat and Amber hobble back up the stage stairs.

dialogues.speaker: AMBER
dialogues.text: We're not getting out...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They push through the battered door and shut it.

dialogues.speaker: PAT
dialogues.text: Guess it was always going to end here.

dialogues.speaker: AMBER
dialogues.text: At least we bought some time. Pat sets her on the couch, crosses to the bathroom.

dialogues.speaker: PAT
dialogues.text: So I’m curious. You're smart... He turns on the sink faucet and gulps water.

dialogues.speaker: PAT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I don’t see how you fall for this shit...

dialogues.speaker: AMBER
dialogues.text: I didn’t fall for anything. I was raped once and mugged twice. Let’s just say none of them were white. Pat nods, gulping water.

dialogues.speaker: PAT
dialogues.text: Any of them women?  87 Pre-Production Draft v.2 (9/07/14) 91

dialogues.speaker: AMBER
dialogues.text: It’s a problem where I grew up.

dialogues.speaker: PAT
dialogues.text: What about tonight? [slurp] Think we gotta white people problem? Amber, losing her mirth.

dialogues.speaker: AMBER
dialogues.text: Fuck you. Pat turns the faucet off.

dialogues.speaker: PAT
dialogues.text: (kindly) Fuck yourself. He joins her on the couch, they sink into the oversized cushions.

dialogues.speaker: AMBER
dialogues.text: I’m the lucky one- they might shoot me. Pat's eyes drift to the makeup counter, the unplugged hai clippers under the WALL SOCKET.

dialogues.speaker: PAT
dialogues.text: ...cell phones ruin everything.

dialogues.speaker: CLARK PULLS HIS FRENZIED DOG OFF SAM'S CORPSE.
dialogues.text: Gabe swoops in, wincing at the GORE as he pats Sam’s pock He pulls out a set of KEYS, DANGLES them for Darcy.

dialogues.speaker: DARCY
dialogues.text: Three will do, gentlemen. The fourth can disappear. Darcy, beaming, turns to Gabe, nearly coming apart.

dialogues.speaker: DARCY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Get the clean up started- gear’s in the shed. I’1l need a push broom. Gabe nods, heads off. Darcy addresses Jonathan.  Pre-Production Draft v.2 (9/07/14) 92

dialogues.speaker: DARCY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I got what I need for up the road- but it’s supposed to have happened already. Time to sprint. Darcy pats Clark’s shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: DARCY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Well done. Clark is patting his BLOODY, INJURED PIT (JD).

dialogues.speaker: CLARK
dialogues.text: Thank him.

dialogues.speaker: DARCY
dialogues.text: ...-nearly got away from me. Us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pat and Amber, on the couch. Insulated, hopeless.

dialogues.speaker: PAT
dialogues.text: Shouldn't we be panicking?

dialogues.speaker: AMBER
dialogues.text: I’m... hungry. Pat regards his ruined, duct-taped arm.

dialogues.speaker: PAT
dialogues.text: ...a week before our tour, my sister and my niece were visiting. I got so pissed at them...

dialogues.speaker: AMBER
dialogues.text: What for?

dialogues.speaker: PAT
dialogues.text: Left the hummus out. One of them did. They drove back the next afternoon... Amber closes her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: PAT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: ...-dried up tub of hummus. Like it was the end of the world. (rubs face) I can’t die with you.  Pre-Production Draft v.2 (9/07/14) 93

dialogues.speaker: AMBER
dialogues.text: So don’t. Feel free to- (almost a smirk) I want the rest of your pep talk.

dialogues.speaker: PAT
dialogues.text: No longer applies.

dialogues.speaker: AMBER
dialogues.text: I’m curious. Paintball? You were cowering?

dialogues.speaker: PAT
dialogues.text: Yeah. Rick Silva- I know you don’t know him- he’s Spanish. We were getting slaughtered by these legit Iraq vets-—

dialogues.speaker: AMBER
dialogues.text: Totally applies.

dialogues.speaker: PAT
dialogues.text: -full cammo, thousand dollar automatic paint-guns. They knew real war and they played real war. Tactics, hand signals, flanking- just wiped us all out. So Rick gets fed up and says ‘fuck it’. Didn't care about getting shot. Didn't take cover. It was hopeless. The last match, the whistle blows and he just tears out there- full jackass, in cut-offs and sneakers- and takes out their entire team. Never stops. Just running and shooting and laughing until they’re all dead.

dialogues.speaker: AMBER
dialogues.text: Pretend dead. We’re up against real guns.

dialogues.speaker: PAT
dialogues.text: Either way, we can’t play real war. Amber's eyes open and drift over the dust-covered carnage

dialogues.speaker: AMBER
dialogues.text: Let’s pretend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A PADLOCK CLINKS closed on the back door latch.  90 91 92 Pre-Production Draft v.2 (9/07/14) 94

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A PADLOCK CLINKS closed on the kitchen exit latch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darcy pulls a FELT BOX from an open SAFE. Gabe removes the SIM card from Emily’s phone, tosses it i the shopping bag, sets the bag in the safe. Darcy shuts the door, spins the dial.

dialogues.speaker: DARCY
dialogues.text: For you... Darcy presents a cellophane-wrapped pack of RED BOOT LACE

dialogues.speaker: GABE
dialogues.text: I don’t...

dialogues.speaker: DARCY
dialogues.text: Just mopping up tonight. You already earned these... Gabe reluctantly takes the laces.

dialogues.speaker: DARCY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Maybe push the contractor depending on the mess. Start looking for a new house band- gotta get back to the routine...

dialogues.speaker: GABE
dialogues.text: Think Cowcatcher’s gonna talk?

dialogues.speaker: DARCY
dialogues.text: I’m more worried about their habit. Really gotta stay away from that nigger dope- bad batch doing the rounds... Gabe flushes with dread. Darcy gives him a kind pat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KEYS turn in the ignition. The engine RUMBLES. Alan stands outside the driver’s door, turns back with a thumbs-up.  93 Pre-Production Draft v.2 (9/07/14) 95 Jonathan shoves the last of THREE WRAPPED CORPSES into th packed cargo hold and shuts the doors. EXT. THE VENUE - LOT —- PREDAWN - CONTINUOUS 93 TRACKING WITH Jonathan, turning to keep pace with Darcy, walking with purpose and a PUSH BROOM. Gabe straggles beh

dialogues.speaker: JONATHAN
dialogues.text: We're set. Darcy tosses the broom in the back of Clark’s IDLING truc

dialogues.speaker: DARCY
dialogues.text: This all hinges on nothing having happened here. Let’s b- (suddenly reverent) Clark nuzzles heads with his WOUNDED PIT (JD), sitting on tailgate.

dialogues.speaker: CLARK
dialogues.text: Bye, buddy... HE EMPTIES A HYPODERMIC SYRINGE INTO THE DOG’S NECK. He hands its chain lead to Jonathan, who twists it around wrist.

dialogues.speaker: CLARK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: He'll stroke out within the hour. I will consider it a personal favor if he dies with meat in his teeth. Clark hands over the break stick, nods.

dialogues.speaker: CLARK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Bite command is ‘fas’. It’s all you'll need. Clark mounts his truck, Darcy leans to Jonathan.

dialogues.speaker: DARCY
dialogues.text: Disregard. The dog slows you down, just shoot who's left- they don't need to be accounted for. Forensics is no longer a concern. (hopping in passenger seat) We call this in too late, all is for naught. Kyle, jogs up, dusting off the shotgun.  94 95 Pre-Production Draft v.2 (9/07/14) 96

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: You guys got any twelve gauge?

dialogues.speaker: DARCY
dialogues.text: (rolling down window) Not in the office. Check the bar.

dialogues.speaker: CLARK
dialogues.text: How many shots left?

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: Three.

dialogues.speaker: CLARK
dialogues.text: So you’ve got an extra. Alan hops in the truck bed, Clark guns the engine, pulls

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The FOAMY-JAWED PIT (JD) leads Jonathan and Kyle through threshold. They sweep by the bar, observing the swirl of BLOOD AND POWDER around the BARTENDER’S CORPSE. Kyle checks under the bar for shot shells, shakes ‘no’, grimacing at Daniel’s (offscreen) body below. Jonathan jogs back to the entrance.

dialogues.speaker: JONATHAN
dialogues.text: Behind the bar- better get started. Jonathan jogs off, as Gabe wheels a SHOP VAC through the door, wearing a backpack POWER WASHER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the PIT (JD) rounds the bend, THE GREEN ROOM DOOR SHUT Kyle and Jonathan follow behind, making their approach... WRRRHHRRRHH. The entire venue WHINES WITH FEEDBACK. They recoil from the PA speakers above, the powerful PIT BUCKS ON HIS CHAIN.

dialogues.speaker: A 96
dialogues.text: 97 Pre-Production Draft v.2 (9/07/14) 97 Jonathan is pulled on his heels, COMING DOWN HARD WITH TH BREAK STICK. JONATHAN (CONT’D) EASY! EASY!...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JONATHAN (CONT’D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabe has propped the door open with a BOX FAN. He connect EXTENSION CORD and it WHIRS TO LIFE. Gabe skinnys up to the wall as the PIT (JD) ROCKETS THROU THE DOOR... EXT. VENUE - LOT —- PRE-DAWN (CONTINUOUS) A 96 THE PIT (JD) CONTINUES INTO THE LOT, AND BEYOND...

dialogues.speaker: GABE
dialogues.text: WHAT’S HAPPENING?

dialogues.speaker: DOG FREAKED.
dialogues.text: (xe: FEEDBACK) TURN THIS SHIT OFF.

dialogues.speaker: GO
dialogues.text: (looking to Kyle) AND DON’T TELL DARCY. OR CLARK.

dialogues.speaker: OKAY.
dialogues.text: 98 99 Pre-Production Draft v.2 (9/07/14) 98 Gabe heads back, ears cupped. Kyle and Jonathan double ba

dialogues.speaker: WHY THE DAMNED DOGS
dialogues.text: Kyle rubs his ear, raises his shotgun.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: HE’S PUTTING IT ON THEM. WE GOING? Jonathan nods. KYLE KICKS IN THE DOOR.

dialogues.speaker: THE UNLOCKED DOOR WHIPS OPEN.
dialogues.text: Kyle steps in, sees A SKINHEAD WITH A MACHETE beside the couch, back turned, looking down the hole in the floor.

dialogues.speaker: SKINHEAD
dialogues.text: (loud muttering)

dialogues.speaker: CLOWN MOTHERFUCKERS
dialogues.text: Jonathan’s in next, pulls the .25 AUTO from his belt.

dialogues.speaker: SKINHEAD
dialogues.text: (muttering) Shazbot...

dialogues.speaker: WHAT
dialogues.text: The Skinhead turns, IT’S PAT, SHAVED HEAD, WEARING BIG JUSTIN'S JACKET, HIS FACE COVERED IN SHARPIE ‘WAR PAINT’.

dialogues.speaker: PAT
dialogues.text: Odin himself. PAT DROPS THROUGH THE HOLE, DISAPPEARING INTO THE FLOOR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PAT DROPS HARD, his pained grimace meshing with a fiendis smirk before scampering deeper into the chamber, CLANKING MACHETE LOUDLY AGAINST THE METAL WALLS...  100 Pre-Production Draft v.2 (9/07/14) 99

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jonathan and Kyle get their bearings. The SPEAKER WIRE above the ceiling tile has been YANKED A ROUTED to the ‘90s CABINET STEREO SYSTEM, a WIRED MICROPH PROPPED AGAINST A SPEAKER, KARAOKE LIGHTS FLASHING. Jonathan yanks the microphone, zeroes the MIXER. THE FEEDBACK REVERBERATES INTO SILENCE. Kyle lifts the plugged-in HAIR CLIPPERS from the counter.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: It’s them. BELOW: PAT’S HAIR CLIPPINGS LITTER THE FLOOR. Jonathan squats by the smashed-up hole in the floor.

dialogues.speaker: JONATHAN
dialogues.text: Gimme the shotgun.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: I got the shotgun.

dialogues.speaker: JONATHAN
dialogues.text: Then go down this fucking hole. Kyle hands over the shotgun, Jonathan sets the .25 down a scoots to the edge... JONATHAN (CONT’D) (checking the breach) Three shots?

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: Yup.

dialogues.speaker: JONATHAN
dialogues.text: You hear me fire twice, you come down no matter what.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: This is a trap.

dialogues.speaker: JONATHAN
dialogues.text: No shit. You wanna go tell Darcy? Kyle shaking his head, cowed.  101 102 103 Pre-Production Draft v.2 (9/07/14) 100

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jonathan drops down, surveys. HEARS THE CLANKING MACHETE.

dialogues.speaker: JONATHAN
dialogues.text: .--he’s gonna be pissed. (up to Kyle) Watch my back. Jonathan creeps forward...

dialogues.speaker: BEHIND HIM, THE COUCH PILLOWS SLOWLY PART AND PUSH UP.
dialogues.text: CREEPING IN, as he grabs the .25, checks the safety.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jonathan follows the CLANKING, shotgun at the ready... Until he stops in his tracks.

dialogues.speaker: JONATHAN
dialogues.text: Fuck this. And backs up to Kyle, shotgun towards the CLANKING. JONATHAN (CONT’D) Get Gabe, man! We need two down here and one up there. (turning to Kyle) Who’s got the thirty-eight?

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: Yeah, somethi-AUQ.. THE BOX CUTTER SWIPES TWICE ACROSS KYLE’S NECK, A GLIMPSE AMBER BEHIND HIM, ALSO IN SHARPIE ‘WAR PAINT’.

dialogues.speaker: WATCHI-...
dialogues.text: Jonathan swings and levels the shotgun- IN HIS SIGHTS:

dialogues.speaker: FLOOR AND SLUMPS TO THE SIDE.
dialogues.text: 104 105 106 107 Pre-Production Draft v.2 (9/07/14) 101

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amber, scoots back, prying the gun from Kyle’s grip.

dialogues.speaker: AMBER
dialogues.text: PAT! HE’S GOT THREE SHOTS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON JONATHAN, patiently waiting for his shot.

dialogues.speaker: JONATHAN
dialogues.text: ..-bitch. PAT CREEPING BEHIND HIM IN WAR PAINT, MACHETE RAISED...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BEHIND A CONTAINER WALL: Pat, faltering, cowering.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ENVELOPED BY NOISE, grimacing Gabe POWER-WASHES behind th bar. The SHOP-VAC WHISTES up BLOODY WATER and SOAP. THE CORPSES OF DANIEL AND THE BARTENDER lie in the foreground, wrapped in HEAVY DUTY TARP.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amber eyes the door, sprawled on the floor with the .25.

dialogues.speaker: PAT, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: (low, through the floor)

dialogues.speaker: AMBER
dialogues.text: She turns to the hole in the floor.

dialogues.speaker: YEAH
dialogues.text: 108 109 Pre-Production Draft v.2 (9/07/14) 102

dialogues.speaker: PAT
dialogues.text: Nevermind... Pat rises to his feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amber grabs the fire extinguisher, crawling to a crouch a she EMPTIES IT INTO THE HOLE...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jonathan swings the shotgun towards the DOWNWARD JET OF PROPELLANT AND FIRE RETARDANT. THROUGH THE SWELLING CLOUD, HE MAKES OUT DANGLING FEET. JONATHAN AIMS AS THE LEGS DROP DOWN... He takes his eyes off the sights.

dialogues.speaker: NICE FUCKING TRY.
dialogues.text: KYLE’S BODY DROPS TO THE FLOOR.

dialogues.speaker: AMBER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: (muffled) Go fuck yourself. Jonathan turns from the CLOUD, Pushing through the thick plastic curtain into the next- WHOMP. The MACHETE CUTS THROUGH CURTAIN AND HITS JONATHAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AMBER (0.S.) (CONT’D) (muffled) ...fuck me...PAT!

dialogues.speaker: JONATHAN PIVOTS ON HIS BACK AND FIRES.
dialogues.text: Pre-Production Draft v.2 (9/07/14) 103 BOOM. A LEG BLOWS APART AT THE KNEE. THE BODY DROPS, THE .25 AUTO CLATTERING NEXT TO IT. Jonathan checks the breech of his shotgun: EMPTY He tosses the shotgun and goes for the .25 AUTO. Picks it up, slides the action. SEES THERE’S NO MAGAZINE. JONATHAN LOOKS UP: AMBER IS ABOVE, HOLDING THE MAGAZINE.

dialogues.speaker: ZERO
dialogues.text: JONATHAN LOOKS DOWN: SEES EMILY’S MUTILATED BODY.

dialogues.speaker: JONATHAN
dialogues.text: Shit. JONATHAN CHARGES PAT... PAT SLAPS IN THE SHOT SHELL, PUMPS THE ACTION ONE-HANDED. JONATHAN CHUCKS THE EMPTY .25 AT PAT... PAT FIRES MID-FLINCH. BOOM! MISSING BY A MILE...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FROM AFAR, in a PILE of CARNAGE, Amber drops down. She quietly closes in as Jonathan throttles Pat like a ra doll, clinging in agony. She picks up the .25 and loads it... Jonathan grabs a SHOT SHELL from the floor.

dialogues.speaker: THE SIDE OF THE HEAD.
dialogues.text: Amber and Pat, faces in ridiculous Sharpie scrawl.

dialogues.speaker: AMBER
dialogues.text: Got him.  112 Pre-Production Draft v.2 (9/07/14) 104

dialogues.speaker: PAT
dialogues.text: Totally... (pained breath) ...flabbergasted that motherfucker.

dialogues.speaker: PULLING OUT FROM THE HOLE IN THE DUSTY FLOOR.
dialogues.text: The shotgun is tossed up through it, CLATTERING to the fl GABE WATCHES FROM THE DOORWAY with his POWER WASHER and S VAC. Amber gets to her feet, locks eyes with Gabe.

dialogues.speaker: GABE
dialogues.text: If I had any ide- She reaches for Pat, helps him up to his feet.

dialogues.speaker: AMBER
dialogues.text: Any more dogs?

dialogues.speaker: GABE
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: PAT
dialogues.text: People?

dialogues.speaker: GABE
dialogues.text: Not here. Up the road. AMBER AND PAT, looking like hammered shit. GABE, dropping his gear.

dialogues.speaker: GABE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I wanna go to jail. SUBTLE, BROODING MUSIC...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PUSHING THROUGH THE BACKSTAGE HALL, The greenroom door op PUSHING ALONG THE STAGE, we hear FOOTSTEPS. PUSHING THROUGH THE MAIN FLOOR, FIRST LIGHT spilling in. PUSHING PAST THE BAR, towards the main entrance.  113 114 116 Pre-Production Draft v.2 (9/07/14) 105 PUSHING IN ON THE DOOR... Gabe exits first, Amber follows with the shotgun, Pat bri up the rear...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Relative euphoria as they absorb daylight. Darcy's truck, Daniel’s convertible- the only vehicles le

dialogues.speaker: PAT
dialogues.text: Can anyone hot-wire a car? Amber and Gabe shake ‘no’.

dialogues.speaker: GABE
dialogues.text: I’d stay off the road anyway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WIDE ON THE ROAD, CRICKETS giving way to BIRDS. A BUILDING NOISE: metallic, grating... The wounded PIT BULL (JD) trots into frame, BLOODY, FOAMI WE TRACK ALONG WITH IT, it’s CHAIN LEAD dragging behind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TRACKING with Pat and Amber, Gabe just ahead.

dialogues.speaker: GABE
dialogues.text: You gonna shoot me?

dialogues.speaker: AMBER
dialogues.text: Where’s Werm?

dialogues.speaker: GABE
dialogues.text: Sent them home, but I don’t think-

dialogues.speaker: PAT
dialogues.text: Let's stay quiet until we’re out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WIDE, THROUGH TREES, they push onward.  Pre-Production Draft v.2 (9/07/14) 106

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TRACKING PAST TREES, they step through the brush. A WEATHERED PAPER SCRAP FLOATS AND TUMBLES NEAR... Pat heads it off, picks it up. ON THE PAPER: Horned skulls, fleshy tendrils and a liquid font of zombie vomit. TAD’S FLYER FROM THE CANCELLED SHOW FAINT VOICES. Pat looks in their direction, then to Amber. She puts a h on Gabe’s shoulder, he stops, turns.

dialogues.speaker: AMBER
dialogues.text: (whispering) It's the residence.

dialogues.speaker: PAT
dialogues.text: (to Gabe) What are they doing?

dialogues.speaker: GABE
dialogues.text: Something you don't want to see.

dialogues.speaker: AMBER
dialogues.text: We can call the cops from the orchard. A VOICE, in the familiar cadence of CLARK’S COMMANDS.

dialogues.speaker: PAT
dialogues.text: (to Gabe) Did you see them die?

dialogues.speaker: GABE
dialogues.text: Two. Not the third-

dialogues.speaker: PAT
dialogues.text: (motioning to the road) Think I'm going... Amber looks to Pat. Shoves Gabe.

dialogues.speaker: AMBER
dialogues.text: Call the cops when you get there. If you disappear I'll find you.

dialogues.speaker: GABE
dialogues.text: I will. Pat takes the .25 from his belt.  Pre-Production Draft v.2 (9/07/14) 107

dialogues.speaker: GABE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I promise.

dialogues.speaker: PAT
dialogues.text: (to Amber) You should go too. Hedge our bets.

dialogues.speaker: AMBER
dialogues.text: You've got 4 rounds and I've seen you pump a shotgun.

dialogues.speaker: PAT
dialogues.text: Fair enough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabe continuing in the background, Pat and Amber now head towards the road...

dialogues.speaker: PAT
dialogues.text: You believe him?

dialogues.speaker: AMBER
dialogues.text: Shhhh. BEHIND THEM NOW, TRACKING TOWARDS THE ROAD. VISIBLE THROUGH THE TREES, THE CONVERSION VAN...

dialogues.speaker: CLARK
dialogues.text: (distant) Nimm futter...nimm futter!

dialogues.speaker: ALAN
dialogues.text: (distant) Jesus. That’s gotta be enough. MOVING THROUGH TREES, PARTIALLY OBSCURED... The conversion van is parked off the road, the driver's s and rear doors hang open in the MORNING BREEZE. Clark commands a massive, square-jawed PRESA CANARIO, RIP

dialogues.speaker: SIDE DOOR. RAW MEAT CARNAGE.
dialogues.text: ON PAT, the faded sharpie war-paint, fighting a gag refle

dialogues.speaker: CLARK, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Lass es. Lass es!... -+-SO ist brav.  Pre-Production Draft v.2 (9/07/14) 108

dialogues.speaker: ALAN, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Think they'd leave the engine on?

dialogues.speaker: CLARK, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Yeah. It’1l run down the gauge too. THE VAN ENGINE RUMBLES AND IDLES. LOCAL RADIO quietly RATTLES through blown speakers. The Presa Canario BARKS.

dialogues.speaker: CLARK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Easy. (to Alan) Let me get this boy tethered.

dialogues.speaker: PAT, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: You got the dog? CREEPING FROM THE WOODS, Pat with the .25 trained on Alan Amber with the shotgun leveled at the Presa.

dialogues.speaker: AMBER
dialogues.text: I got the dog. ON CLARK, quiet shock as he sees them.

dialogues.speaker: PAT
dialogues.text: Police or murder. Alan glances back to a gated driveway five yards down the road, then to Clark.

dialogues.speaker: CLARK
dialogues.text: Police.

dialogues.speaker: PAT
dialogues.text: (to Alan) Then gimme your gun.

dialogues.speaker: ALAN
dialogues.text: I don’t have one.

dialogues.speaker: PAT
dialogues.text: I‘1l shoot you either way if you don’t hand me one. Alan reaches in his belt and sets the .38 on the ground.

dialogues.speaker: CLARK
dialogues.text: Listen-  Pre-Production Draft v.2 (9/07/14) 109

dialogues.speaker: AMBER
dialogues.text: Shhhhh. Let’s tether that dog.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON A RUSTED SIGN WIRED TO AN ENTRY GATE: ‘BEWARE OF DOGS’ Clark, his Presa, and Alan move past, Amber and Pat behin Clark's MODEST PRE-FAB HOUSE sits in from the road. Beyon it, the property opens up into acres of low grass fields.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE HAND OF REECE’S STREWN, MUTILATED, CORPSE... A GNARLED FIGHTING DOG, SHOT DEAD on the ground just ahea Then Darcy, dusting away BOOT TRACKS with the push broom, away from CLARK'S TRUCK: By the rear wheels, THE MATTED BLUE HAIR OF TIGER’S CORPS

dialogues.speaker: WITHIN, THE RUBBER HOSE AND RAG FROM THE SIPHON KIT.
dialogues.text: Darcy finishes up with a broom tap.

dialogues.speaker: PAT, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Looks fishy. Darcy looks to the ensemble, sags with despair.

dialogues.speaker: PAT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: The cloth is to make a seal. Wouldn’t stuff it in like that. Darcy returns a cautious nod.

dialogues.speaker: ALAN
dialogues.text: They got my thirty-ei-.

dialogues.speaker: AMBER
dialogues.text: Shut up. (to Clark) Hook that dog up or I blow it and you away. Pat takes the SHARPIE from his jacket, scribbles a LARGE SWASTIKA above the gas tank.  120 121 122 Pre-Production Draft v.2 (9/07/14) 110

dialogues.speaker: PAT
dialogues.text: That’1ll be hard to explain. Darcy seethes as Clark lethargically hooks the Presa’s le to a WIRE RUN-LINE between two METAL POSTS. It trots off.

dialogues.speaker: CLARK
dialogues.text: (turning) So why d-

dialogues.speaker: BOOM. AMBER HITS CLARK WITH BUCKSHOT TO THE RIBS. PAT JUM
dialogues.text: CLARK CRUMPLES, SPURTING BLOOD FROM A 3” ENTRY WOUND.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabe reacts to an ECHOING, DISTANT CRACK, quickens his pa

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The injured PIT (JD), slowing, drags his chain up the roa

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PAT, REGARDING CLARK’S DEAD BODY, BLOOD SOAKED GRASS.

dialogues.speaker: PAT
dialogues.text: So we’re doing that?

dialogues.speaker: AMBER
dialogues.text: Why else would we walk up here?

dialogues.speaker: PAT
dialogues.text: When I... I was going to ruin the crime scene.

dialogues.speaker: AMBER
dialogues.text: (eyes on Darcy and Alan) Thought we’d leave a new one. Pat swallows, turns to look back at the carnage.

dialogues.speaker: PAT
dialogues.text: (back to Darcy) ...-this IS A NIGHTMARE! Heaving with shock and adrenaline, Pat’s voice carries fo miles. Even Amber is reverent.  123 124 Pre-Production Draft v.2 (9/07/14) 111

dialogues.speaker: DARCY
dialogues.text: For us all.

dialogues.speaker: AMBER
dialogues.text: Tell me those stupid fucking words are his last.

dialogues.speaker: I...
dialogues.text: (to Darcy) You have a cell phone? Darcy shakes a near-imperceptible ‘no’.

dialogues.speaker: PAT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Funny... you were so scary at night- DARCY TURNS AND RUNS. It’s almost sad. POP. PAT MISSES with the .25, KICKING UP DISTANT DIRT. ALAN CHARGES. BOOM! BLOWN BACK BY AMBER’S BUCKSHOT. POP. PAT HITS DARCY IN THE BACK. BOOM. AMBER TAKES OUT DARCY'S LEGS WITH BUCKSHOT.

dialogues.speaker: WOUND EJECTS A STEADY ARC OF BLOOD.
dialogues.text: DARCY FIRES the .454 RUGER. BOOM. IT’S A CANON. CLARK'S TRUCK TAKES THE SLUG.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Presa BARKS on the run-line. Darcy slumps to the grou as Amber and Pat approach, guns raised. They watch him fade, lower their weapons. SERENE MUSIC BUILDS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sun crests a hill, backlighting trees. Birds CHIRP.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The place is quiet. Little sign of last night’s events.  125 126 127 128 129 Pre-Production Draft v.2 (9/07/14) 112

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MIGRANT WORKERS, men and women, mostly Latin, harvest HONEYCRISPS from a row of manicured TREES. Gabe, BLOOD STAINED and ragged, approaches from a fence. HIGHWAY is audible nearby.

dialogues.speaker: GABE
dialogues.text: We need police. INT. TAD’S APARTMENT - BEDROOM - MORNING 126 A DOOR OPENS OFF SCREEN, spilling sunlight on THE CLUSTER FRAMED CAT PHOTOS.

dialogues.speaker: D-
dialogues.text: See you after my shift. I hope you both like eggs.

dialogues.speaker: -T
dialogues.text: INT. WERM’S HOUSE - BASEMENT - MORNING 127 Specks of light penetrate bedsheet-covered windows. The Guitarist and Drummer are on the floor by the couch, frozen in TIGHT-JAWED RIGOR MORTIS, a NEEDLE IN THE GUITARIST’S ARM. SOMEONE behind them, rocking in front of the TV. It’s Werm, in cool, fuzzy light, eating a BOWL OF CEREAL. Hard to tell if the CREEPING SIRENS come from the TV...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The conversion van remains IDLING by the road, doors agap

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON THE RADIO, the driver's door open in the background. RATTLING QUIETLY, Tad's Ain't Rights INTERVIEW on FM 85.5 A SHAPE OUTSIDE THE VAN MOVES LOW ACROSS FRAME.  130 Pre-Production Draft v.2 (9/07/14) 113

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amber and Pat are seated on the gravel, heads resting aga the bumper of Clark’s truck. They see the shape: The wounded PIT (JD), BLOOD SOAKED AND GNARLY. It stalks up the driveway towards them... Amber and Pat raise their guns. CLICK. CLICK. CLICK. All three of them on their last leg, the PIT (JD) limps p sniffs out Clark’s body and curls up next to it. The Presa Canario whimpers from its tethered line. Pat and Amber slump back, quiet takes hold. The van’s RADIO barely audible.

dialogues.speaker: PAT
dialogues.text: -..I know what it is.

dialogues.speaker: AMBER
dialogues.text: (eyes ahead) What what is...

dialogues.speaker: PAT
dialogues.text: My desert island band. Two beaten, half-assed warriors in the late summer breeze

dialogues.speaker: AMBER
dialogues.text: Tell somebody who gives a shit. CUT TO BLACK.
